title: Video Editor (Growth Path to YouTube Channel Management)
description:
Paid Trial to Long-Term Role



Company: Share Wealth Systems

Location: Remote

Engagement: Full time



About Share Wealth Systems:



Share Wealth Systems creates long-form educational content for traders who want to build disciplined, rules-based processes. Video content is a core part of how we educate and support our community, particularly through YouTube.



About the Role:



We’re hiring a Video Editor who is excellent at execution and interested in growing into a broader YouTube role over time.



You do not need to have YouTube marketing or channel management experience yet.



What matters most is strong video editing fundamentals, and genuine interest in learning how YouTube channels are structured, optimized, and grown.



Early on, this role is execution-focused. Over time, there is a clear opportunity to grow into YouTube SEO and channel management responsibilities with training and guidance.



What You’ll Be Responsible For:

Phase 1: Video Editing (Primary Focus)

- Editing real backlog videos using Adobe Premiere Pro

- Maintaining consistent quality, pacing, and clarity

- Creating and integrating AI-generated video elements where appropriate (e.g. avatar-led or explainer segments), using tools like HeyGen

- Delivering edits reliably and iterating based on feedback

- Working closely with the marketing and sales team to stay aligned with brand standards and performance goals



Phase 2: Growth Into YouTube Channel Work (Over Time)

- Learning how videos are structured and organized on YouTube

- Supporting playlist creation and basic channel organization



Gradually contributing to:

- titles and descriptions

- basic YouTube SEO fundamentals

- channel consistency and hygiene



You’ll be trained and supported as you grow into this side of the role.



Required Skills & Experience:

- Strong proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro (non-negotiable)

- Solid video editing fundamentals (pacing, structure, storytelling)

- Experience creating or working with AI-generated video content (HeyGen or similar tools)

- Ability to work with pace and meet deadlines

- Clear written and verbal communication

- Openness to feedback and willingness to learn new skills



Nice to Have (Not Required):

- Any exposure to YouTube content or channels

- Curiosity about YouTube SEO, playlists, or channel structure

- Interest in long-term ownership beyond editing



If you don’t have these yet but want to learn, that’s completely fine.



How We Evaluate Candidates:



As part of our hiring process, we use OnlineJobs.ph assessments to help us better understand how candidates think and work. These include:

- IQ test

- DISC behavioral assessment

- Personality assessment



These tests are not about passing or failing. They help us assess learning style, communication preferences, and overall fit for the role and team.



We care far more about how you work and think than generic strategy documents or polished interview answers.



Application Process:

As the first step, we’d like you to submit a short 3–5 minute video introduction. In your video, please answer the following:

- Tell us about yourself and your background.

- Why are you interested in working with Share Wealth Systems (Reference Share Wealth Systems on the video)?

- Share a brief note on your experience with YouTube channels (editing, management, or both).



Please upload your video to Google Drive, Dropbox, or use Loom and send us the relevant link here along with your resume. We’re looking for clear communication and a genuine introduction.

title: Digital Advertising Management
description:
Project: European Market Launch – Premium Footwear

Role: Digital Marketing Specialist (Remote)

Date: February 5, 2026

________________________________________

1. Project Overview

The objective is the strategic launch and sell-out of an initial production run (100 units) of luxury flat shoes retailing at €350. Because of the high price point and EU tax structures (VAT/Duties), the focus is on high-precision targeting and maximum margin protection.



2. Compensation & Terms

• Weekly Rate: $80 USD

• Monthly Retainer: $320 USD

• Payment Schedule: Weekly upon delivery of the Performance Report.

• Trial Period: 6 months

• Pay rate & Bonus: As our business scales, we’ll increase your pay rate accordingly. I also plan to offer performance-based bonuses to reward strong results



3. Scope of Work (The Strategy)

Because every click is expensive for a €350 product, your tasks focus on conversion quality over quantity:

Weekly Execution

• Niche Targeting: Maintaining ad sets strictly focused on "High-Net-Worth" and "Luxury Fashion" interests in specific European markets.

• Ad Creative Management: Deploying 2–3 "Premium Aesthetic" ad variations per week. Focus on craftsmanship and exclusivity.

• Retargeting Funnel: Managing a dedicated campaign to re-engage users who viewed the product but did not purchase.

• Lead Capture: Ensuring the website "Pop-up" is capturing
s effectively to reduce our blended CPA.

• Friday Report: Detailed breakdown of Spend, Sales, ROAS, and Cost Per Add-to-Cart.

Monthly Strategy

• Competitor Benchmarking: Monitoring luxury footwear trends in Europe to ensure our creative remains competitive.

• Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO): Suggesting website improvements to reduce "Cart Abandonment."

• Audit: Ensuring Meta Pixel and GA4 are tracking revenue accurately (inclusive of VAT).

________________________________________

4. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

These targets are non-negotiable to maintain business profitability:

• Target ROAS: 6.0x (We require €6 in revenue for every €1 spent to cover VAT, duties, and logistics).

• Target CPA: €45.00 (The maximum spend allowed to acquire a single customer).

• Add-to-Cart Rate: 3% – 5% (A leading indicator of price acceptance).

• Stop-Loss: If the CPA exceeds €75.00 over a 3-day average, ads must be paused for immediate strategy review.

________________________________________

5. Communication & Tools

• Workspace: clickup/ MS Teams (Daily) and MS Teams/Google Meet (Weekly).

• Approvals: No ad shall go live without written approval of the creative and copy.

title: Web Designer
description:
We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency seeking

Website/Graphic Designer

(1 full-time, remote position available)



You are a highly creative, motivated and reliable team player who has experience and proficiency in generating jaw dropping and highly converting graphic design. You have strong attention to detail, creative thinking and are committed to personal growth through learning & implementing new skills and technologies.



We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency specialise in helping speakers, coaches and service based businesses build and scale million dollar offers through paid ads and sales training.



We are seeking a Graphic Designer to generate jaw dropping and high converting graphics for our landing pages, static ad creatives, webinar/training slides, membership sites and posters… And join our highly motivated team of account manager, media buyer, web designer/tech specialist and copywriter to further our growth.



You must:

Design high converting graphics by employing principles of visual hierarchy, colour psychology, and typography to create clear and compelling calls-to-action

Implement A/B testing for various graphic elements to determine which designs yield the best conversion rates

Employ high converting designs for webinar and training slides to enhance credibility of speaker and learning of students

Understand and implement the best UX practices for different types of graphic types

Leverage analytics tools to gain insights into how users interact landing page and modify designs for maximum performance

Document practices into standard operating procedures

Multitask and work toward several milestones on various projects simultaneously

Work effectively with our team of media buyers, copywriters and video editors to ensure seamless integration of GoHighLevel with our existing processes

Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to digital marketing and graphic design





Requirements:

Proven experience generating jaw dropping and attention grabbing graphics

No coding experience is required

Want to work with a highly motivated team & value personal growth

Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Highly creative, attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work

Proficiency in basic design tools such as Canva, photoshop

Experience in the marketing industry





If you are keen to work with our driven, collaborative and value-creating team, please complete the form below for consideration, and you will be notified once your application has been processed.

title: Ecommerce Video Editor (Facebook & TikTok UGC Ads)

 and 
. We're looking for a Video Editor to join our team and help us create scroll-stopping ads that convert.

 and 
 ad creatives and what drives conversions

title: Online ESL Instructor
description:
Join Our Mission:



At Everest English School, our mission is to open up a world of opportunities for young learners. Unlike English education, which often focuses on test-driven learning, heavy on conventional grammar and translation, we are dedicated to equipping students with practical English communication skills. We bridge the gap between traditional education and the essential skills needed for global interactions.



We are seeking experienced and adaptable Online ESL (English as a Second Language) Instructors to teach Japanese students from Grade 1 to Grade 12. As our company continues to grow and innovate, we are entering a dynamic phase where teaching methods may evolve. Therefore, we value instructors who are open to ongoing training and flexible in adapting their instructional approaches. You will play a vital role in supporting students’ language development while helping shape the future of our learning programs.



Responsibilities:

Teach English to Japanese elementary, junior high, and high school students (ages 6–18) in a one-on-one online format

Deliver engaging, age-appropriate lessons tailored to each student’s needs and proficiency level

Adapt teaching strategies based on feedback, training, and evolving curriculum standards

Monitor student progress and provide regular feedback to both students and parents

Participate in training sessions and tea ---------- etings to stay updated on instructional changes

Maintain accurate lesson records and communicate proactively with support staff



Qualifications:

Native or Near-Native English fluency with no requirement for Japanese.

Bachelor’s degree required (preferably in Education, English, or a related field)

TESOL, TEFL, or CELTA certification strongly preferred

Minimum of 2 years of teaching or tutoring experience, preferably with children and/or teens

Experience teaching Japanese students is a strong plus

Ability to deliver dynamic lessons and manage classroom behavior in a virtual setting

Openness to learning and adapting teaching methods through training and feedback

Proficiency with online teaching tools; reliable internet, headset, and quiet workspace required



Working Hours:

Each workday will include at least two 25-minute lessons (totaling an hour or more per day).

The expected monthly working hours are approximately 24 hours.

Lessons will be scheduled between 3:00 PM and 9:00 PM (JST), including weekends.

Please note: We will give priority to candidates who are available to work on weekends and public holidays.



Compensation:

Competitive hourly rate based on experience, qualifications, and performance



If you are interested, we kindly ask you to submit the following two items.

Please be aware that missing either item will result in an incomplete application.

1.Your most recent resume

2. 1-minute self-introduction video in English



?This will be an outsourcing (independent contractor) agreement, not a part-time employment contract.



We give priority to candidates who are available to work on weekends and public holidays.

title: Client Success Manager
description:
We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency seeking

Client Success Manager

(1 full-time, remote position available)



Do you love helping people win?



If yes — we want to hear from you.



???? Who We Are

We’re TRES, Singapore’s fastest-growing performance marketing agency.

We help speakers, coaches, and service-based business owners build and scale million-dollar offers through paid ads, sales funnels, and high-level mentoring.



We also run a powerful software called Intellia, and we’re looking for a Client Success Manager to help our users, mentees, and private clients get the results they came for — with world-class support and systems.



???? What You'll Be Doing

You don’t need to know everything before applying — if you have the attitude and aptitude, we’ll guide you through our proven systems, templates, and workflows.



Your role is to make sure clients win. You’ll be working closely with our internal team and clients to ensure they stay supported, engaged, and on track.



Client Success & Support

- Onboard new clients (software users, mentees, private clients) with our proven onboarding flow



- Track their progress and follow up if they’re stuck or inactive



- Support on coaching calls (note-taking, sending reminders, summarizing action steps)



- Monitor success metrics and improve retention using simple reporting tools



Event Management (Local & Overseas)

- Help us organise and coordinate live events — from sourcing venues to handling logistics



- Liaise with vendors, book venues, and manage client comms before, during, and after the event



- You don’t need prior experience — if you’re detail-oriented and resourceful, we’ll teach you



Community & Relationship Building

- Be the go-to person clients turn to when they need clarity or support



- Help manage our client groups and foster accountability, progress, and wins



- Cheer them on. Clients stay when they feel seen, supported, and celebrated



???? Requirements

You don’t need to tick all the boxes — if you’re confident you have what it takes, we want to hear from you.



? Strong English speaking is a must; English writing is a bonus

? Good with people, even better at follow-through

? Detail-oriented and able to juggle multiple tasks or clients

? Strong sense of responsibility and problem-solving

? Familiarity with tools like Google Sheets, ClickUp, or GoHighLevel is a plus

? Bonus: Event or client support experience in digital/marketing/coaching fields



???? Why Join Us?



Work remotely with a high-performing, passionate team



No time tracking. You work toward clear KPIs and results



Travel opportunities to support client events



You'll never feel like “just a support role” — you’ll be a key player in client wins



If you're ready to grow with a world-class team and make a real impact, apply now:

title: Website Designer
description:

Landing Page Builder | Tech Support

(1 full-time, remote position available)



You are a highly motivated and reliable team player who has an eye for detail in website and graphic design. You are able to effectively convert graphic, video and copywriting into a landing page that is user-friendly with eye-catching graphics and buttons that convert.



You are able to provide technical assistance and support to clients and tea
mbers within the marketing agency.You are conversant in website design, building and maintenance (good typology, UX/UI, graphic design & technical skills) and speak & write English. Optimise landing pages for UI/UX (user experience/user interface)

Ensure designs align with clients' branding and marketing objectives

Implement conversion rate optimization (CRO) techniques, such as A/B testing, heatmaps, and user behaviour analysis.

Build opt-ins,
 sequences, SMS sequences, and appointment booking automations using our copy and paste templates & SOPs





Key Responsibility #2 - Provide technical support to clients, management and tea
mbers

Maintain and troubleshoot marketing agency tools and systems

Respond to technical support requests within 24 hours

Create membership areas and upload course materials into learning portals

Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues within 24 hours

Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical users in a clear and understandable manner

Assist with the setup and maintenance of CRM, project management tools, and marketing automation platforms (e.g. Notion & GoHighLevel)

Ensure the proper functioning of hardware and software within the agency.





Key Responsibility #3 - Collaborate with clients, management and tea
mbers



Communicate with clients to gather requirements, feedback, and approvals for marketing campaign

Work effectively with our team of media buyers, copywriters and video editors to build the landing page and conduct split tests

Work effectively with our team to ensure our clients maximise their ROI with us

Assist with the setup and maintenance of CRM, project management tools, and marketing automation platforms

Work with our copywriter/media buyer to create ad creatives

Document practices into standard operating procedures

Multitask and work toward several milestones on various projects simultaneously





Requirements:



Experience

Preferred certification & experience in web design, graphic design, information technology, or digital marketing

Prior experience in creating landing pages and providing technical support, preferably within a marketing or digital agency setting

A portfolio showcasing a variety of successful landing page projects and demonstrated technical problem-solving abilities.





Skills

Strong visual design skills, including colour theory, typography, layout, and UX principles

Proficiency in graphic design tools, such as Canva, Photoshop or Illustrator





Interpersonal and communication skills

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical users

Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities

Patience and empathy when dealing with clients and colleagues experiencing technical difficulties





If you are keen to work with our driven, collaborative and value-creating team, please complete the form below for consideration, and you will be notified once your application has been processed.

title: Appointment Setter
description:

 for your recording and send the link by reply here.

title: Senior Shopify Landing Page Developer
description:
We are seeking an experienced and proactive Shopify Web Developer who specializes in building high converting landing pages within the Shopify ecosystem. This role is perfect for someone who understands both design and performance, can move fast, and knows how to translate brand assets into clean, optimized, mobile first pages that drive sales. You will collaborate closely with the Marketing Director, Creative Team, and E-Commerce Manager to bring campaigns and product launches to life.



Key Responsibilities



- Own the full build process for Shopify landing pages from wireframe to final publish.



- Develop fast, mobile optimized pages using Shopify themes, Liquid, custom sections, and app integrations.



- Work closely with the Marketing Director on funnels, CRO tactics, and campaign landing pages.



- Collaborate with designers to turn Figma or Canva designs into pixel accurate Shopify pages.



- Optimize pages for speed, SEO fundamentals, and smooth user experience.



- Maintain and update existing landing pages across multiple Shopify stores.



- Solve layout issues, theme conflicts, and app compatibility problems.



- Document reusable components, templates, and workflows for efficient future builds.



- Implement tracking scripts, pixels, UTM placements, and custom events when needed.



- Provide recommendations to improve conversion, retention, and page performance.



Requirements



- 3+ years experience building Shopify stores, landing pages, or theme development.



- Strong experience with Shopify Liquid, custom sections, CSS, and responsive design.



- Comfortable working with marketing teams on direct response pages, funnels, and CRO.



- Strong understanding of Shopify apps, metafields, variants, and theme structure.



High accuracy and attention to detail across layouts, spacing, and design systems.



Proven ability to manage multiple page builds and deadlines at once.



Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate daily with designers, copywriters, and marketing leads.



Experience optimizing page speed, image compression, and clean code practices.



Preferred (Not Required)



Experience with Figma files and design handoff.



Experience building custom Shopify apps or advanced Liquid functions.



Familiarity with tools like Shogun, Pagefly, Replo, or GemPages.



Basic understanding of analytics, conversion tracking, and split testing tools.



How to Apply



Please send your CV, portfolio links, and a short summary of your Shopify landing page experience.

Teach tea
mbers how to use ClickUp without overwhelming them

Stay Curious & Continuously Improve

 What You Bring

title: AUDIT SPECIALIST
description:
Role: Audit Specialist/Auditor

Department: Audit & Sales Operations

Reports To: Audit Team Manager

Work Schedule: Eastern Time Zone covering morning, evening, and even after midnight intervals (Mon–Fri, some weekends during events)

Location: Remote





Position Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented, reliable, and systems-savvy Audit Specialist to join our fast-paced, mission-driven Audit and Sales Operations team. This role is critical in ensuring accuracy, consistency, and accountability across sales and challenge-related activities. As an integral part of the back-end operations, you will conduct daily audits, maintain CRM hygiene, support process improvement, and enable smooth communication and tracking within the Sales ecosystem.





Key Responsibilities:

Sales Support & Auditing

Provide back-end operational support to the Sales Team during Challenges and Events.

Review agreements/contracts to ensure they are accurately sent, signed, and complete.

Verify and update the status of funding applications, agreements, and transactions.



CRM & Data Integrity (GoHighLevel, PhoneBurner, Google Sheets):

Audit CRM (GoHighLevel) for duplicate entries, incorrect contact info, missing tags, and data inconsistencies.

Ensure sales appointments are correctly logged, tagged, and assigned to the appropriate tea
mbers.

Audit undispositioned appointments and ping reps to update appointment outcomes

Identify and merge duplicate contacts to maintain clean data records.



Sales Pipeline & KPI Monitoring:

Review sales pipelines to ensure leads are in the correct stage.

Monitor the status of pending leads, update lead information, and verify lead ownership.

Record, review, and report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) submitted by the Sales Team.



Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain and update Audit Sheets, Running Sales Commissions Sheets, Sales Stats Sheets, and Ticket Sales Sheets.

Generate and share daily reports on stats, top performers, rankings, and cash collections to Slack channels.

Design and maintain checklists, trackers, and templates for process standardization.



Automation & Systems Management:

Build/test automations using Zapier to streamline processes like Google Form to Slack integrations.

Set up and manage user accounts for Sales, Challenge, and Audit teams in Slack, GHL, and
 systems.

Create and update Google Forms for data collection related to ticket sales, upgrades, and challenges.

Modify calendars and Smartlists in GHL for scheduling and segmentation.



Communication & Team Collaboration:

Set up dedicated Slack channels for challenge communications and sales discussions.

Attend regular meetings with the Audit Team, Bookkeeping Team, and other stakeholders.

Tag or remind Sales Reps to follow up with leads or update CRM records.

Generate unique payment links, cancel/resend agreements, and ensure proper financial documentation.





Preferred Systems Knowledge:

GoHighLevel (GHL)

PhoneBurner

Zapier

Google Suite (Sheets, Forms, Calendar, Gmail)

Slack

ClickUp





Key Qualities & Skills:

High attention to detail and organizational skills

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment

Clear communication and a team-player mindset

Proactive and process-oriented with a continuous improvement attitude

Comfortable working across various time zones and collaborating virtually

Our clients aren't basic, and neither are we - which is why we need someone confident, experienced, and meticulous to help us level up this tax season and beyond.

? Prepare and file individual and business tax returns (1040, Schedule C, 1065, 1120S)

Assistance with quarterly filings in US, estimated taxes, Process sales & use tax

description:
A* Funding is a U.S.-based private money lending company that provides short-term, asset-based loans to real estate investors. We focus on first- and second-position loans, bridge funding, gap funding, and creative real estate transactions.



We value clean execution, capital protection, and professional communication.



Role Overview



We are hiring a Loan Processor/ Jr. Underwriter to support real estate deals from intake through funding. This role is the operational backbone of our lending business and works directly with borrowers, brokers, and internal leadership.



This is not a bank mortgage role. You will support private money deals using CRM pipelines and internal workflows.



Key Responsibilities



Manage real estate deals inside the CRM.

Collect, organize, and review borrower and property documents.

Assist with preliminary deal review (LTV, ARV, exit strategy – no approvals)

Prepare deals for internal review and decision-making

Communicate with borrowers and brokers via
, phone, and chat

Request missing documents and follow up to keep deals moving

Coordinate with title companies and insurance providers for closings



Track conditions, timelines, and closing tasks

Maintain clean CRM records, notes, and document uploads

Assist with light lead follow-up and deal intake

Important Authority Boundaries







Requirements

2+ years experience in real estate transactions, loan processing, or lending support

Strong attention to detail and organization

Excellent written and spoken English

Comfortable communicating with U.S.-based clients

Ability to manage multiple deals at once

Experience using CRMs and pipeline-based systems



Nice to Have (Not Required):

Private money or hard money lending experience

Familiarity with real estate investing terminology

GoHighLevel or similar CRM experience



What Success Looks Like

Clean, accurate CRM records

Deals move smoothly with minimal rework

Borrowers feel informed and supported

Leadership does not need to fix or chase files



How to Apply

Please apply with:

Please submit your resume along with a brief introduction explaining your relevant experience and why you’re an excellent fit for this role. Include the word “Lending" in your application message so we know you read this fully.

title: Full-Time Administrative Assistant (Long-Term, Remote)
description:

Core Responsibilities

Administrative support and coordination

 and calendar management

Research (policies, zoning, vendors, childcare-related information)

Maintaining trackers, logs, and status updates

Calls are procedural and informational only



You will not represent yourself as the owner, license holder, or decision-maker

You will state you are providing administrative support on behalf of the project lead

Calm, professional communication style

Tools & Workflow

-based communication

Compensation

This Role Is

Long-term

Stable

Process-heavy

Not a short-term gig

title: Job Application Specialist / Virtual Assistant (applying to jobs)
description:
We’re hiring an application specialist to apply to jobs and contract opportunities.



This is not an entry level role.



You must already have real, hands on experience successfully applying to roles for another client and producing interviews, callbacks, or offers.



If you have not done this before for a real client, please do not apply.



Your job is to find relevant roles and submit accurate, well matched applications using approved materials and process.



Accuracy and judgment matter more than volume.



You will:

Find relevant job and contract opportunities that clearly match the client’s background

Review each role carefully before applying

Customize small parts of applications when needed using approved notes and templates

Submit applications using the client’s resume, profile, and materials

Track every application in a shared sheet

Flag high quality or unusual opportunities for review

You will only use approved information and materials.

You must never create fake profiles or misrepresent experience.



We will provide:

The client’s resume and background

Positioning and short intro messages

Approved templates and examples

A clear step by step system

You will not be guessing.



Mandatory experience

To be considered, you must have:

Prior success applying to jobs or freelance roles for another client

Proof that your past work resulted in interviews, replies, or qualified leads

Experience working independently without needing daily supervision





Required skills:



Strong written English

Extremely high attention to detail

Very comfortable using job platforms and application forms

Able to follow instructions exactly

Strong personal organization and tracking habits



Nice to have:

Experience applying for roles in consulting, marketing, tech, or agency environments

Experience using LinkedIn and major job boards

Experience supporting founders, consultants, or agencies



Hours and schedule

Part time to start

Around 10 to 20 hours per week

Long term role if performance is strong



Pay

Please include your hourly rate in your application.

Important note



How to apply



Please include:

1. A short description of the client you previously supported and what types of roles you applied for

2. A brief example of results you achieved (interviews, replies, shortlists, etc.)

3. Your weekly availability and hourly rate

title: Virtual Assistant (Admin, Website, Marketing & Business Growth)
description:
* About the Business



I run a construction business that has been temporarily paused due to a back injury. I am now in the process of restarting and growing the business back to what it once was. This role is a key part of that journey.



I am looking for a highly capable and motivated Virtual Assistant who can take ownership of the administrative and marketing side of the business and help drive growth moving forward.



This is a long-term role for the right person.



* About the Role



This is a hands-on, multi-skilled role. You will be the main (and only) virtual assistant handling admin, website, marketing, and customer communications.



Your first major task will be recreating the company website using 
. This is intentional — I want you to gain a strong understanding of the business from day one and feel a sense of ownership and pride in helping rebuild it.



From there, you will help create and execute strategies to bring in new construction jobs and manage the day-to-day admin required to keep the business running smoothly. 



**There will be a performance based bonus model for successful secured jobs.**



* Key Responsibilities



> Your tasks will include, but are not limited to:



- Recreating and managing the company website using Wix



- Developing a marketing and business strategy to secure construction jobs



- Contacting potential stakeholders, partners, and clients to promote services



- Responding to customer enquiries quickly and professionally



- Managing the company
 inbox



- Issuing invoices and following up on outstanding payments



- Creating newsletters and managing mailing lists



- Identifying and sourcing potential construction jobs across various platforms



- General administrative support as needed



* Required Skills & Experience



> We are looking for one highly capable VA, not multiple assistants. You should have experience in:



- Website design (especially Wix)



- Marketing and business development



- Customer service and client communication



- Administrative tasks and organisation



- Professional written English



* Nice to Have (Not Required)



- Background or experience in the construction industry



> This is desirable but not essential — construction knowledge can be taught over time



* Who This Role Is Perfect For



- You enjoy taking ownership of your work



- You like helping rebuild and grow a business, not just doing repetitive tasks



- You are proactive, organised, and comfortable working independently



- You are looking for a long-term role with growth potential



* How to Apply



> Please include:



- A brief introduction about yourself



- Your experience with Wix website design



- Your background in marketing and admin



- Examples of websites or marketing work you’ve done (if available)



- What country you would love to visit

title: Photo Editing VA – Lightroom & Photoshop Expert (Wedding & Family Photography)
description:
We’re looking for an experienced and reliable Photo Editing VA who excels in both Lightroom and Photoshop to join our small photography team.



About the Role:

You’ll be working on editing galleries from weddings and family photography sessions, with a strong focus on maintaining consistency with our current editing style (predominantly natural, soft, true-to-colour with clean skin tones and a light, timeless feel).

The work will start with weddings and family sessions, but over time will become predominantly family sessions. This role with start as occasional work but will grow into ongoing work with around 2 sessions to edit per week. 



Key Responsibilities:

    •    Consistent Lightroom editing in line with our existing style (we’ll provide reference galleries and presets)

    •    Basic Photoshop work such as head swaps (for group shots where someone is blinking or looking away)

    •    Occasional object or distraction removal (e.g., removing ugly background landmarks from key photos)

    •    Timely delivery of edited galleries (reliable turnaround times are essential)

    •    Good communication – must be comfortable asking questions if unsure and providing progress updates



Requirements:

    •    Proven experience editing professional wedding and family photography (this is essential – please don’t apply if you do not have this)

    •    Strong proficiency in Lightroom Classic and Adobe Photoshop

    •    An eye for detail and consistency in skin tones and colour

    •    Ability to follow a reference style and adjust your editing approach accordingly

    •    Reliable internet connection and fast computer capable of handling large RAW file batches

    •    Strong file management and organisational skills



Bonus (but not required):

    •    Experience working with international photographers

    •    Experience using AI-assisted editing tools (optional, but a plus)



To Apply:

Please send:

    1    A brief introduction about your editing experience

    2    Links to sample galleries or before/after examples of your editing work

    3    Details of your editing setup (computer specs, internet speed, software versions)

    4    Your expected monthly rate for part-time work (with potential to increase hours over time)



Looking forward to finding someone who takes pride in delivering high-quality edits and understands the nuances of working with professional photography clients.

Start date: ASAP

title: Senior VA Recruiter & VA Team Manager
description:
MV Corporate is Hiring: Senior VA Recruiter & VA Team Manager (Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Growth)



TO APPLY:



Please submit the following:



1. Your **updated resume or CV**

2. A **voice or video recording** explaining your experience and why you're the right person for this role (1–2 minutes)

3. Share any examples of **roles you’ve hired for**, teams you’ve led, or SOPs you’ve created



MV Corporate is a U.S.-based real estate and business consulting company headquartered in Texas. We operate multiple divisions across property management, real estate lending, acquisitions, operations, and digital marketing. As we scale, we are building a world-class team of Virtual Assistants and are looking for a **Senior VA Recruiter** to help us find, train, and manage top talent from the Philippines and beyond.



**Position Overview: Senior VA Recruiter & VA Team Manager



We are seeking a **highly experienced and resourceful VA Recruiter** who will take ownership of our entire hiring pipeline — from job posting and screening to onboarding, SOP development, and VA performance oversight.



This role reports **directly to the CEO** and will evolve into a leadership role overseeing our growing remote team. You must be proactive, highly organized, and confident leading tea
mbers in a fast-paced U.S.-based business environment.



Key Responsibilities:



Recruitment & Hiring



* Post job openings on OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn, and internal referral channels

* Screen resumes, conduct initial interviews, and shortlist candidates

* Create and maintain hiring SOPs, scorecards, and role-specific assessments

* Coordinate test tasks, interview rounds, and onboarding logistics

* Maintain and manage an up-to-date **pipeline of qualified VA candidates**



Onboarding & SOP Development



Create onboarding checklists and SOPs for each role and department

Ensure all new hires are properly trained and equipped for success

Manage Google Drive folders, SOP libraries, training decks, and documentation

Collaborate with department leads to update and streamline workflows



VA Management & Team Oversight



Act as the **primary point of contact** for all VAs across departments

Hold team check-ins, performance reviews, and provide support and accountability

Track VA performance and handle issues related to productivity, attendance, and communication

Report directly to the CEO with weekly updates on hiring status and VA tea
trics

Lead initiatives to improve culture, retention, and operational efficiency



Required Skills & Qualifications:



4+ years of experience in VA recruitment, HR, or team management supporting U.S.-based CEOs or companies

Proven track record of hiring and managing remote teams

Deep understanding of the Philippine VA talent market

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Confident conducting interviews, giving feedback, and making hiring decisions

Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and follow-through



Proficiency in:



Google Workspace(Docs, Sheets, Calendar, Drive, Gmail)

Trello or similar PM tools

GoHighLevel (GHL) is a plus

Fast, reliable internet connection and ability to work independently



Bonus If You Have:



* Experience creating VA hiring funnels, assessments, and quizzes

* Familiarity with real estate, lending, or property management roles

* Background in VA coaching, mentorship, or people operations

* Experience writing or maintaining a company SOP hub or knowledge base



Growth Opportunity:



This role will **start as a solo VA recruiter** but has the potential to grow into a **Team Lead or Director of Operations** role as we scale. You'll be trusted to manage, train, and build the VA department from the ground up.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant (Operations & Finance Focus)
description:
*Please Read Thoroughly* Thank you!



Location: Remote

Must be available for Hours: ,

8:00 AM – 12PM Pacific Time (Seattle)

8:00pm - 10PM Pacific Time (Seattle)

Additional Projects can be worked outside of these time sets 



Overview

We are seeking a Virtual Executive Assistant to assist me directly with my day-to-day business operations. This role is designed to function as an extension of me operationally. The primary objective is to reduce friction, close loops, and keep the business moving forward.



This is a results-driven, long-term role. The specific tasks will evolve over time as trust is built and as you take on more responsibility. Accounts Receivable, invoicing, and outbound phone calls are core initial responsibilities, but this is not a narrow or static role.



This position is not task-only or “on-demand.” You will be on call, at your computer, during scheduled hours and expected to self-manage time professionally. These time slots are: 8:00 AM – 12PM Pacific Time (Seattle) and 8:00pm - 10PM Pacific Time (Seattle)



Core Responsibilities (Initial Scope)

You will assist me with daily operational execution, including but not limited to:



QuickBooks Online support



Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable tracking



Invoicing and payment follow-ups



Outbound phone calls to customers, vendors, and accounts on my behalf to gather feedback, confirm details, and resolve open items



Documentation of outcomes and ensuring tasks are actually completed, not just attempted



As the role matures, responsibilities will expand into broader operational support based on performance and reliability.



Required Skills & Experience

Strong, hands-on experience with QuickBooks Online is mandatory, including AR and AP workflows. You must be confident and professional on the phone, capable of representing the business clearly and competently. You must demonstrate strong self-management, time discipline, and written communication. You must be comfortable remaining at your workstation and available during scheduled hours, even during slower periods. You must be comfortable with screen sharing or screen recording during clocked-in hours.



Work Expectations & Accountability

Results are what matter. Output, accuracy, and follow-through take priority over appearances or “busy work.”



Honesty is non-negotiable. Dishonest timekeeping, inflated activity, or misrepresentation of work will result in immediate termination. This role operates on trust backed by verification. You are expected to manage your workload independently, stay engaged, and proactively identify productive work when task volume is low.



Being available during scheduled hours is required. Being disengaged, unreachable, or misreporting activity is not acceptable.



Schedule & Availability

Must be on Desk Working For between 8:00 AM – 12PM Pacific Time (Seattle) and 8:00pm - 10PM Pacific Time (Seattle). If candidate proves to be a good fit, additional projects can be worked in addition to these time slots at their own discretion (Up to 40 hours per week) 



Who This Role Is For

This role is for someone who wants a long-term virtual executive assistant position, values accountability, and is comfortable operating in a results-first environment. If you take ownership, adapt quickly, and want to grow alongside a business rather than hop between short-term gigs, this role is a strong fit. 



Message from the business Owner:

I'm looking for a strong Executive Assistant to help me manage my day to day operations and business. I've had experience working with Other VA's but I haven't come across a VA i'm looking to invest or commit to long term. If you are looking to just work for pay and treat this as a job, I'm sorry this isn't the job for you. I'm looking for someone who would join me in trying to make my business successful and understand that this isn't just a job for me, its my business and pursuing to grow it and continue on with other businesses. The right candidate for me understands my position (previous experience will help if you have been an executive assistant to another business owner)  and really puts their best effort in helping me succeed and run my business and you have my word, I will return the favor to the right candidate. I don't expect to find the right candidate immediately but I appreciate you for applying and working with me if you have. Thank you for taking the time to read this. 



How to Apply

To be considered, you must submit all of the following:



A brief video (1–3 minutes) of yourself speaking in English to demonstrate communication clarity and professionalism.



A summary of your relevant work history, with emphasis on QuickBooks Online, AR/AP, invoicing, and phone-based responsibilities.



A short written explanation of why you are a strong fit for this role, specifically addressing results, self-management, honesty, and your interest in a long-term position.



iPhone or access to iMessages is a big advantage because this is where communication happens. Thanks for understanding!



Pay: Flat Retainer $200 Per week or hourly Rate $10 per hour, which ever is higher and paid weekly.

title: Buyer Assistant Role for Hungry, Driven Talent
description:
Join a Fast-Growing Startup Built for People Who Want More



We’re not looking for “just an assistant.”

We’re looking for hungry people — teammates who want to learn fast, grow fast, and earn more.



If you’re driven, action-oriented, and tired of slow careers with capped salaries, this opportunity is for you.



What You Get (First Things First)



Performance-based salary increases every year

? The better your results, the more you earn. No ceiling.

Extra paid day off during summer

Paid holidays

Employee discounts on the products we sell

Long-term career opportunity for people who deliver results

A startup environment where effort is noticed and rewarded

A company culture that values ambition, growth, and real money

This is not for people looking to coast.

This is for people who want to build skills and income.



Your Role



You’ll work closely with the team on core operations and commercial tasks:



Support daily operations and business activities

Manage B2B purchasing and product sourcing

Negotiate with suppliers confidently

Use Excel (basic to intermediate level)

Make simple Photoshop edits (titles, minor adjustments)

Use AI tools (ChatGPT, DeepSeek, etc.) to work faster and smarter

Work efficiently with a minimum two-screen setup

Track the price of the concurrent and update all our stores.

Analyze and track all the different prices from different suppliers.



Who We’re Looking For



Experience in B2B purchasing or supplier negotiation

Strong communication and negotiation skills

Organized, reliable, fast learner

Basic Photoshop skills (beginner level is fine)

Comfortable with Excel

Familiar with AI tools (ChatGPT, DeepSeek, etc.)

Hungry mindset  with strong self-discipline— you want to grow, earn more, and push further

Monitor competitor pricing and update pricing across all our stores accordingly.

Analyze and track pricing variations across different suppliers.



No lazy mindset.

Only motivated, driven people.



How to Apply (Important)

B2B only:

title: Outbound Sales Closer – Food / FMCG
description:
Read first:



This job is daily cold calling to takeaway shops & grocers in Australia.

If you don’t like cold calling, don’t apply.



What you do

• Call local takeaway shops & grocers

• Offer free samples

• Follow up after sample drops

• Convert the sample drop into a first full-price order

• Hours: Monday–Friday, Australian business hours (approx. 9am–5pm AEST)



Once a shop orders, the account is handed off.

You do not manage reorders or ongoing accounts.



What this is NOT

• No inbound leads

• No account management

• No marketing or strategy work



This is dial>talk >>>convert.



Pay

Commission is paid on adoption, not trials.

• AUD $1,000 monthly base

• AUD $30 one-off commission per converted account

o Commission is paid only when the shop places its first full-price order (2nd order)

o No commission on sample drops or discounted trial orders



Who should apply

• Comfortable making cold calls all day

• Proven experience hitting sales targets

• Can handle rejection

• Clear English

• Reliable and consistent



Sales experience helps. Discipline matters more.



REQUIRED TO APPLY



Applications without an answer will be ignored.



You are given a list of 150 takeaway shops to call in one working day.

How would you structure your calling day to get through the list and book trials?

(5–6 sentences max. Be practical.)

*** Attach your resume with your answer.

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
Our client is seeking a dynamic and strategic Marketing and Social Media Manager to support their growing brand. This role is key in translating complex technical solutions into engaging, results-driven storytelling. The ideal candidate will elevate brand presence, highlight innovative projects, and drive lead generation through targeted digital marketing strategies. This position is well-suited for someone with a passion for technology and experience creating compelling content for both B2B and B2C audiences.



Apply on this form:





Key Responsibilities



Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy aligned with the client’s growth objectives and expertise in AV and IT integration.



Manage social media platforms including LinkedIn, Instagram, and X by creating consistent posting schedules and engaging with industry partners, influencers, and clients.



Create high-quality content such as case studies, blog posts, white papers, and video scripts that showcase completed projects and technical capabilities.



Oversee the client’s website, ensuring content is current, SEO-optimized, and provides a seamless user experience for prospective customers.



Plan and manage
 marketing campaigns to nurture leads, promote new service offerings, and share company updates.



Monitor and report on marketing performance using tools such as Google Analytics and social media insights to refine strategies and maximize ROI.



Collaborate with sales and technical teams to capture project highlights and translate technical details into effective marketing materials.



Coordinate the client’s participation in industry trade shows and local networking events, including promotional materials and booth support.



Qualifications and Skills



Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.



3–5 years of experience in marketing or social media management, ideally within technology, construction, or professional services industries.



Strong understanding of the AV/IT space, including unified communications, digital signage, and network infrastructure.



Proficiency with content creation tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Canva, or similar design and video editing platforms.



Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail and brand consistency.



Experience using CRM systems and marketing automation tools to track lead engagement and conversions.



Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects and deadlines.



Proactive mindset with a strong interest in digital marketing trends and emerging technologies.



Why Join This Opportunity



This role offers the chance to work with a forward-thinking organization at the intersection of technology and innovation. The selected candidate will contribute to high-impact projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and play a meaningful role in expanding the client’s digital presence within the AV/IT industry.





Apply on this form:

title: U.S. Insurance Disputes Specialist
description:
Summary

We are seeking a decisive, results driven legal professional based in the Philippines who has experience handling U.S. insurance companies and is comfortable pushing back when carriers delay or refuse to pay valid claims.



This role is for someone who understands U.S. insurance processes, policy language, and common delay tactics, and who is confident applying legal pressure through documentation, escalation, and regulatory awareness. You thrive in high accountability environments, move with urgency, and take ownership of outcomes.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage and drive disputes with U.S. insurance companies from initial resistance through resolution.

• Analyze insurance policies, correspondence, and claim documentation for leverage points.

• Draft firm, professional demand letters and responses aligned with U.S. standards.

• Identify delay tactics and escalate matters appropriately and efficiently.

• Track deadlines, maintain organized case documentation, and support resolution strategies.



Ideal Candidate

• High D personality with the confidence to challenge insurers and push matters forward.

• Strong analytical skills and attention to detail when reviewing policy language and claims.

• Experience working with U.S. insurance companies, claims, or legal processes required.

• Comfortable working independently in a remote environment with clear accountability.

• Excellent written English and professional communication skills.



Job Details

• Fully remote position based in the Philippines.

• Work hours aligned with U.S. Eastern Time.

• Direct collaboration with U.S. based leadership and legal teams.



Call to Action

If you are comfortable confronting U.S. insurance companies, driving disputes to resolution, and delivering results without hesitation, apply now. Be prepared to demonstrate how you push back, escalate, and win.



To apply, submit a 30-second (or longer) video introducing yourself and why you'd be a great fit. We’ll only consider applications with a video, so we’re excited to hear directly from you!

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Accountant / Bookkeeper for Comprehensive Financial Support



Job Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accountant / Bookkeeper to provide comprehensive support across various financial domains in our company. This remote, freelance position requires expertise in handling Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and reconciliation.



The ideal candidate will be proactive, efficient, and committed to timely and accurate financial reporting and management.



Responsibilities:



- Accounts Payable (AP): Assist with invoice processing, ensure timely payments, and work on maximizing cash flow efficiencies. Manage vendor relationships and handle any disputes or issues to maintain positive engagements.



- Accounts Receivable (AR): Support the billing and collections processes to ensure they are optimized for faster cash cycles. Handle customer queries and ensure clear and transparent communication to strengthen customer relations.



- Record to Report (R2R): Help maintain accurate records of all financial transactions and ensure compliance with accounting standards and legal requirements. Support the generation of reports that offer insights into the financial health of the business.



- Payroll Management: Assist in processing payroll accurately and on time, adhering to all tax regulations and internal policies.



Required Skills and Qualifications:

- Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

- Proven bookkeeping experience, with a strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.

- Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Xero, or similar.

- Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.

- Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

- Effective communication skills, capable of handling interactions with tea
mbers and external partners.



Additional Information:

- This is a remote position with flexible hours, ideal for freelancers.

- Start your application with the word:  CoFE in the header to ensure you read the entire description

- Immediate availability is preferred.

- Candidates should include a detailed resume and a brief cover letter outlining relevant experience and qualifications.

title: Video Editor for #1 Podcast Production Studio
description:
TBC Studios produce some of Australia's FAVOURITE podcasts ... yep literally #1 on the top charts.

But we're not your average podcast studio ... TBC Studios is where sound meets strategy.

Most podcast studios will give you a room with a mic, hit record and edit it into something you can upload to Buzzsprout, perhaps with a reel or two to share on social media.

 We don’t do that.

We start every single podcast with the intention to build a brand and a community, to create something that people can't wait to listen to every single week.

But we're not just creating content. Every single podcast we put out into the world has the potential to be exactly what someone needs to hear today to change their life.

 And our job is to get those episodes into the ears of those that need to hear it most.

----

We work with incredible brands, influencers and people who are voices of authority in their field ... so we are searching for someone who LOVES podcasting and telling stories. 

Who understands how to stop the scroll, research trends and is excited to build out growth strategies that will help our clients reach more people than ever before. 





You’ll own: 

- Building channel strategies for our clients incorporating their podcasts and ensuring this aligns with overall brand and content strategy

- Repurposing our podcasts videos into shortform clips for instagram, tiktok, youtube shorts and LinkedIn 

- Providing feedback and guidance for clients on videography setup and additional trends to incorporate

- Identifying ways to constantly innovate and ensure these videos and audiograms stand out across each platform.

- Use our clients branding to create unique visual identities for each reel and platform 

- Complete long format editing in conjunction with our producers including audio enhancement and colour grading 

- Create motion effects and other edits that capture attention 

- Create thumbnails and provide input into text and captions to ensure our assets are recieved well. 



We'd love you to apply if you: 

- Have exceptional communication skills, attention to detail and love creating

- Are skilled in video editing on either Adobe Premiere or Davinci 

- Have created long and short form content

- Want to create something that is ON BRAND ... not just copying what everyone else is doing

- Want to create something that geniunely makes a difference and has IMPACT 

- Are passionate about learning about the algorthims and what works for each platform 

-Are proactive, take initiative and passionate about the success of our clients

- Believe in 'going hard' or 'going back to the studio'

- Always want to continue learning and upskilling to bring the best of the best.



Here's why you'll love working with us 

- You’ll be surrounded by a team of smart and driven creatives who genuinely care - about their work, their clients, and each other.

- You'll be paid to listen and learn from some of the most incredible minds in the lifestyle, business, property, coaching and crypto world (no boring convos over here)

- Ability to work remotely with some flexibility in hours

- We invest in people who take ownership and initiative and in return, we back you with real mentorship, feedback, and room to grow.



If this sounds like you, apply here -

title: E - Commerce Video Editor
description:
Overview

We are seeking an exceptional, data-driven Video Editor obsessed with driving conversions for e-commerce/DTC brands. This is a fast-paced role requiring a marketer's mindset, platform expertise, and rapid iteration based on performance data.



Core Responsibilities (What You Will Do)

Conversion Focus: Edit raw footage (often UGC-style) into scroll-stopping, short-form ads (15-60 seconds) for Meta, TikTok, and YouTube, focused entirely on driving sales.



DR Implementation: Structure videos using Direct Response (DR) frameworks (e.g., Problem-Agitate-Solution), ensuring a powerful hook in the first 3 seconds, and seamless CTA integration.



Technical Execution: Apply advanced post-production techniques: color grading, audio mixing, speed ramping, dynamic transitions, and creating engaging typography/subtitles.



Rapid Iteration: Maintain fast turnaround (24 for first cuts) and produce multiple testing variations based on performance metrics (CTR, ROAS, Hook Rate).



Platform Mastery: Optimize content (9:16, 1:1, etc.) for native feel and best practices across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Ads.



Pre-requisites (Must-Haves)

Experience: Proven portfolio of successful e-commerce/DTC ad editing (not just cinematic/corporate work).



Software Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro.



Mindset: Deep understanding of DR Marketing and key metrics (ROAS, CTR). Must be performance-driven, flexible, and willing to iterate based on data without ego.



Skills: Expertise in UGC-style editing, audio/sound design, and closed captioning/subtitles.



Bonus Skills

Proficiency in After Effects, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve.



Familiarity with ad platforms and marketing metrics.



Workload: Initial paid trial project, then transitioning to 20 hours per week ongoing.



Shift: Flexible hours; work is output-based with strict deadlines.



To Apply:

If you are an exceptional designer with a portfolio that demonstrates world-class DTC brand quality, kindly fill out the application form:






Looking forward to receiving your application!

You understand Funnelish dropshipping logic (ad ? angle ? funnel ? conversion)

? Big Ups If You Have



Experience with 
 ads for
/Instagram



Direct-response or dropshipping background

?? Role Details



Full-time only



High daily output

Remote possible (responsiveness is non-negotiable)

Send:

title: Cost-Estimator/ Project Administrator
description:
Premium Australian BPO is seeking an experience Cost-Estimator/Project Administrator for our client, and Australian specialist demolition and civil works company operating across NSW Australia. This client specializes in delivering complex early works, demolition, excavation, civil services and remediation. 



This Full-Time (FT) role offers the flexibility to work-from-home (WFH), a market-leading salary package including paid leave + bonuses. Be a key player on a dynamic team supporting tendering, cost-estimating, cost-planning and project administration functions. 



This role is ideal for someone with strong construction estimating fundamentals who understands Australian construction standards and systems and enjoys working closely with project and estimating teams. This role is focused on accuracy, documentation, and internal project support.



****Key Responsibilities Include ****



-Prepare project take-offs and Bills of Quantities (BOQs)



-Utilise established rates for cost-estimating and cost planning



-Support development of early works methodologies for demolition and civil projects



-Assist with tender submission preparation



-Coordinate and review subcontractor pricing



-Support safety systems and documentation



-Work within and support the company’s IMS (Integrated Management System) requirements



-Maintain accurate and well-organised project documentation





*****Required Experience & Skills to apply includes****



- Minimum 4 years proven experience in construction estimating. 

- Minimum 4 years proven experience in project administration

- Previous experience with an Australian construction company. 

- Strong understanding of NSW / Australian construction systems. 

- High level of proficiency with Bluebeam software. 

- High level of proficiency with Excel and Microsoft Office. 

- High level of proficiency with English both verbal and written. 

- High level of attention to detail and accuracy. 

- Reliable, accountable and deadline oriented. 

- Ability to work independently and as part of a dynamic team. 

- Comfortable supporting multiple tenders/projects simultaneously. 



****WFH Setup**** This role requires candidates have a complete WFH set-up in place including

- Laptop

-Monitor

-Fast and reliable internet

-Back-up internet options

-Back-up power options



****How to Apply**** Please provide the following for your application to be considered 



- Your CV

- A brief summary of your experience in construction estimating and project administration. 

- A brief summary of your previous Australian experience. 



Thank you!

title: Estimator – Low Voltage / Technology Systems
description:
Structured Progress LLC is a U.S.-based low-voltage and technology integrator supporting commercial clients across security, access control, networking, AV, and structured cabling.



We are seeking a detail-oriented Estimator to support our sales and project teams by preparing accurate, well-organized estimates for commercial low-voltage and technology projects.



This is a full-time, Philippines-based remote position with required overlap during U.S. business hours.



Key Responsibilities

Prepare detailed cost estimates for commercial low-voltage projects, including:

Structured cabling

Security cameras (CCTV)

Access control systems

Networking (switches, routers, WAPs)

AV and conferencing systems

Perform quantity takeoffs from drawings, PDFs, and markups

Build Bills of Materials (BOMs) with accurate part numbers and quantities

Enter estimates into company estimating tools or spreadsheets

Apply labor units based on defined labor norms and installation standards

Coordinate with sales, project managers, and technical staff to clarify scope

Identify scope gaps, assumptions, and exclusions

Revise estimates based on feedback, RFIs, or scope changes

Maintain organized estimate files and documentation

Follow company estimating SOPs and naming conventions



What This Role Is NOT

You will not negotiate pricing with customers

You will not determine profit margins independently

You will not manage projects or field technicians



This role focuses on accuracy, consistency, and support, not sales.



Required Experience & Skills

3+ years of estimating experience in low-voltage, construction, or technology systems

Strong understanding of commercial low-voltage systems and components

Experience reading construction drawings and floor plans

Comfortable performing takeoffs from PDFs (Bluebeam experience is a plus)

Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

High attention to detail and organization

Ability to follow defined processes and templates

Clear written English communication

Comfortable working with U.S.-based teams and deadlines



Preferred (Nice to Have)

Experience with security or access control estimating

Familiarity with manufacturers such as Ubiquiti, Hikvision/Digital Watchdog, Brivo, Honeywell, Shure, Logitech, etc.

Experience working with U.S. integrators or construction firms

Bluebeam Revu or similar markup tools

Basic understanding of labor units and installation time assumptions

Schedule & Compensation

Full-time, remote (40 hours/week)

Required overlap with U.S. business hours

Monthly salary range: PHP 70,000 – 100,000, depending on experience and skill level

Performance reviews and growth opportunities as the company scales



How to Apply (Important)

To be considered, please answer all questions below in your application message. Applications without answers may not be reviewed.



1. How many years of estimating experience do you have, and in what type of projects (low voltage, construction, technology, etc.)?

2. What types of systems have you estimated (e.g., cabling, CCTV, access control, networking, AV)?

3. Describe your experience performing quantity takeoffs from drawings or PDFs. What tools do you use?

4. How do you ensure accuracy when building a BOM and labor estimate?

5. Have you worked with U.S.-based clients or companies before? If yes, describe your experience.

6. What estimating or documentation tools have you used (Excel, Bluebeam, others)?

7. Are you comfortable working full time with required overlap during U.S. business hours? Please confirm.

8. What is your expected monthly salary in PHP?



Please also include a link to your resume or portfolio if available.



About Structured Progress LLC



Structured Progress is a growing U.S.-based low-voltage and technology integrator supporting commercial clients in security, networking, AV, and infrastructure projects. We value accuracy, accountability, and long-term tea
mbers who want to grow with us.

title: Administrative Assistant to the Principal
description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to provide comprehensive support to the Principal of our audio-visual (AV) firm. This role is central to ensuring the Principal’s daily operations run smoothly, allowing them to focus on high-level strategy, client relations, and business growth. The ideal candidate possesses a blend of executive-level administrative expertise and a genuine interest in the AV and technology integration industry.



Apply on this form: 



Key Responsibilities

Manage and maintain the Principal’s complex calendar, including scheduling internal meetings, client consultations, and site visits while proactively resolving scheduling conflicts.

Act as the primary point of contact for the Principal, screening incoming calls, managing
 correspondence, and ensuring timely follow-ups with clients, vendors, and tea
mbers.

Coordinate all travel arrangements, including flights, lodging, and ground transportation, often involving multi-city itineraries for industry trade shows or remote project sites.

Assist in the preparation of project proposals, client presentations, and technical documentation by gathering necessary data and ensuring all materials meet company branding standards.

Organize and maintain digital and physical filing systems for project contracts, blueprints, and sensitive financial documents to ensure quick retrieval and data integrity.

Track and manage the Principal’s expenses, preparing monthly reports and ensuring all receipts are reconciled with company accounting software.

Facilitate communication between the Principal and the engineering, sales, and installation teams to ensure project milestones are being met and deadlines are clear.

Perform general office management tasks as needed, such as ordering supplies, coordinating office maintenance, and preparing the conference room for high-profile client meetings.

Qualifications and Skills

Proven experience as an Administrative Assistant, Executive Assistant, or in a similar support role, preferably within the AV, construction, or technology sectors.

Exceptional organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Strong proficiency in office productivity software, including Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Excel, Word) and project management tools like Basecamp.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a professional demeanor suitable for interacting with high-net-worth clients and corporate executives.

A high degree of discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive business information and Principal-level communications.

Basic understanding of audio-visual terminology and equipment is a significant plus, though not strictly required for a candidate willing to learn.

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while remaining a collaborative and supportive member of the broader administrative team.

title: Accounting & Tax Virtual Assistant (Junior to Mid-Level, Australia-Focused)
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Accounting and Tax Virtual Assistant to support our team with Australian tax, compliance, and accounting tasks. We're seeking someone with a broader understanding of Australian accounting standards, BAS/IAS compliance, and business tax reporting.



This role is ideal for a junior to mid-level candidate who is comfortable working virtually, has strong proficiency in Xero, and is eager to grow their career in virtual accounting services with an Australian focus.



Core Competencies

- Hands-on experience in Australian accounting and tax

- Proficiency in Xero (Australian version); experience with QuickBooks or MYOB is a plus

- Ability to handle a variety of accounting tasks, including:

- BAS and IAS preparation and lodgement

- GST, PAYG, and Superannuation compliance

- Preparation of financial reports for businesses, trusts, or companies

- Familiarity with Division 7A, FBT, CGT, and PSI rules (a bonus, not a must)

- Support for business tax return preparation and small business tax strategies



Preferred Qualifications

- CPA certification or working towards CPA is preferred but not essential

- 1–4 years of experience in an Australian accounting role

- Prior experience working remotely or in a virtual assistant capacity is a plus

- Technical Skills

- Strong knowledge of Xero, including:

- Tax code setup and reconciliation (GST, GST-free, input-taxed)

- BAS/IAS preparation and submission through ATO Portal

- Payroll processing in compliance with STP and Superannuation

- Ability to generate and interpret financial statements and management reports

- Skilled in using Excel or Google Sheets for tax tracking, analysis, and reconciliations

- Familiarity with tools like TaxCalc, Business Fitness Workpapers, and ATO online services



What You'll Do

- Support and work with accountants with day-to-day tasks relating to Australian tax compliance

- Assist in the preparation of business activity statements (BAS), payroll, and reconciliations

- Manage financial records with attention to accuracy and ATO compliance

- Help prepare documentation for year-end tax returns and reports

- Maintain clear communication and reliable task tracking in a remote setting



This is a long-term, remote opportunity for someone who is ready to move beyond data entry and basic bookkeeping and gain deeper experience in Australian tax and financial support. You’ll work alongside experienced accountants and be part of a collaborative team. Apply now if you're detail-driven, tech-savvy, and committed to helping businesses meet their compliance and financial goals.

We see this business as a family run business and would love you to be apart of it if you think you are the right fit!

s, ensuring nothing slips through the cracks

- Handling product returns from both customers and suppliers



- Uploading invoices to Amazon to gain approval (ungating) for branded products and following up where needed



* What We’re Looking For



> Essential Experience:



- Proven experience with Amazon FBA, within a uk market



- Customer service (ideally in e-commerce)



- Experience working with UK-based wholesalers and retailers



- Strong understanding of e-commerce operations



- Knowledge of UK import/export regulations and associated costs



- Experience with the Amazon ungating process



- A goal-driven attitude and experience working to KPIs



*  Tools & Software



 > Required:

- Airtable

- Keepa



- SellerAmp (SAS)



- QuickBooks



- Sellerboard



* Language & Tech Requirements

- Stable and reliable internet connection



* What We Offer



- Be part of a business from the ground up – with future management and leadership opportunities

We’re looking for someone reliable, proactive and ready to grow with us. If that’s you – we’d love to hear from you!

If your application is successful, you’ll be invited to an interview with our two founders. The interview consists of two parts: a Q&A session, followed by a short practical task based on the responsibilities outlined in the role.
