title: Senior Video Editor for DTC Footwear Brand- $1600-$2500 USD Per Month + Performance Bonus
description:
Senior Video Editor for DTC Brand - STABI

**Remote | Full-Time | $1,700–$2,500 USD Monthly Base + Performance Incentives**



At most eCom teams, “Video Editor” really means…

You’re handed messy footage, unclear direction, last-minute requests - and somehow you’re expected to create a “winning ad” with zero context.



You end up doing a lot of editing, but not much high-quality execution.



We know because we’ve been there.

***And Spoiler Alert: It wasn’t for us.



So instead of guessing what the creative team wants, what if you got clean briefs, clear messaging, and actual tools that help you move faster?



A company that provides systems like ReCharm (video organization) and 
 (video feedback) so you’re not wasting time in messy Google Drive folders - and can focus on what matters: shipping great edits, on time.



Fun right?



Well, that’s exactly what the Senior Video Editor role at STABI is all about.



We’re Australia’s fastest-growing footwear brand (selling primarily worldwide). For privacy reasons, we’ve hidden the brand name in this posting - but you’ll be solely focused on one brand, not multiple clients.

-----------------

About Us



We’re STABI — a performance-driven footwear DTC brand. Last year, we did 8-figures USD in revenue, and we’re scaling aggressively through world-class creative and marketing execution.



This is not an agency role.

You’ll be solely focused on our brand, our ads, and our growth.

-----------------

The Role: What You’ll Own



As a Senior Video Editor, you’ll be responsible for executing ad briefs from our creative team and applying the finishing touches that make the message land.



This is not “just clip cutting.”

This is marketing-first editing - where hooks, pacing, structure, clarity, and proof make or break performance.



Important: 99% of our videos are under 1.5 minutes.

Speed and timeliness matter - we move fast, and on-time delivery is non-negotiable.



-----------------



Your Core Responsibilities:



Onboarding



• Learn our brand style, creative standards, and winning ad patterns.

• Get up to speed with our workflow tools: ReCharm (video organization) + 
 (feedback).



Ongoing



• Edit 5–10 ad briefs per week (performance ad creatives for paid social).

• Edit exclusively in CapCut (required).

• Use Video AI generation tools to support ad production (required).

• Turn scripts into high-quality voiceovers using ElevenLabs (required) and integrate them into final edits.

• Upload & organise edited ads inside ReCharm (no messy Google Drive workflows).

• Collaborate with Copywriters & Creative Directors to ensure concepts are executed correctly.

• Listen to feedback and iterate fast using 
.

• Learn our Ads Strategy so you understand what makes “Winning” vs “Losing” ads.

• Complete a weekly 30-minute ad analysis + review on concepts you’ve worked on.



-----------------





What We’re Looking For



Must-Have Experience:



• 1+ year editing performance ads (eCommerce preferred).

• CapCut experience is mandatory (we do not use Adobe). [Vertical video formats (9:16)]

• Video AI generation experience is mandatory (include tools/workflows you’ve used).

• Experience editing UGC + direct response style creatives.

• Experience with ElevenLabs and turning scripts into voiceovers (required).

• Strong organisation + file hygiene (naming systems, specs, exports, versions).



Must-Have Traits:



• Fast + reliable: you hit deadlines without being chased.

• Excruciating attention to detail (the small stuff matters here).

• Strong creative instincts and visual storytelling ability.

• Great communicator - proactive, responsive, and coachable. Advanced English Comprehension.

• You can move quickly without sacrificing quality.

• Strong understanding of Meta ad creatives



-----------------



Bonuses (Nice to Have):



• Experience editing for a footwear product (or apparel/accessories).

• Basic knowledge of copywriting / direct-response principles (hooks, proof, objections).

• Strong in Canva graphic design (Static DTC Ads - simple overlays, captions, product callouts, layouts).



-----------------



This is NOT for you if:



• You don’t enjoy editing content daily.

• You struggle with deadlines or need constant follow-ups.

• You’re unorganised or sloppy with file management.

• You dislike feedback loops and iteration.

• You don’t understand (or don’t want to learn) performance creative.



------------------



Hours



• M–F | 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM PST (flexible) (we can figure this out together)



------------------



Growth Potential



At STABI, we value growth and development. With great performance, your upside is significant:



• Priority on editing the best concepts and receiving the bulk of creative requests.

• Performance bonuses based on output, speed, and creative results.

• Opportunity to grow into a Lead Editor / Creative Strategist role over time.



-----------------



***TO APPLY, SEND BOTH OF THE FOLLOWING (IMPORTANT):***



   1. A 2–4 minute Loom video introducing yourself + your experience, and sharing your highest-spend ads with key metrics (ROAS, hook rate, etc.). (Addressed to Danielle - Not a past recording)

   

   2. 2–5 examples of performance ads you’ve edited 
/Instagram links preferred).



Next steps (if selected):



• You’ll receive a paid editing test task (brief + feedback).

• If the test looks good, we’ll book a final interview.



If you want to edit high-performing ads for a proven 8-figure footwear brand—with clean briefs, faster workflows, and a team that values speed + quality—apply now.



•••No Loom addressed to Danielle + no ad examples = not considered.•••

title: Marketing Coordinator (Client)
description:
POSITION PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

The primary responsibility for this position is to plan, execute, and manage the company’s marketing initiatives 

end-to-end, with a strong focus on CRM management, content creation, and digital marketing. This role ensures 

that marketing campaigns are effective, timely, and aligned with the company’s strategic objectives. The 

Marketing Coordinator will also assist with administrative tasks when marketing workload is light, contributing 

to the overall efficiency of business operations.



This role is responsible for, but not limited to:

1. Overseeing and managing all marketing initiatives from start to finish.

2. Managing and optimising the company’s CRM system to support marketing and sales activities.

3. Creating compelling content across multiple channels including
s, blogs, and social media.

4. Assisting with SEO, analytics, and marketing reporting to improve campaign performance.

5. Supporting the development of marketing automation within the CRM.

6. Providing design support for marketing materials and campaigns as required.

7. Undertaking general administrative tasks when marketing workload is low.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

• Set up, manage, and maintain the CRM system for marketing and sales purposes.

• Plan, execute, and manage marketing campaigns and initiatives end-to-end.

• Develop and execute
 marketing campaigns (EDMs) using CRM and
 platforms.

• Write engaging copy for blogs, newsletters, social media, and other marketing channels.

• Optimise content for SEO and monitor performance using analytics tools such as Google Analytics.

• Assist with creating marketing graphics, layouts, and visual content where needed.

• Build and manage CRM automations to streamline marketing workflows and client engagement.

• Monitor marketing campaign performance, prepare reports, and recommend improvements.

• Identify new marketing opportunities and independently drive initiatives to completion.

• Undertake general admin tasks to assist the wider team during low marketing periods.

• Maintain accurate records of marketing activities, assets, and campaigns.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

• Proven ability to manage marketing initiatives independently from start to finish.

• Experience in CRM management, marketing automation, and data-driven marketing.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong copywriting ability.

• Knowledge of SEO best practices and content optimisation.

  Experience with Google Analytics or other marketing analytics tools.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Google Workspace cloudbased tools.

• Familiarity with graphic design tools like Canva is desirable.

• Experience with Asana or similar project management tools is ideal.

• Organised and detail-oriented, able to manage multiple priorities under pressure.

• Problem-solving mindset with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.

• Tech-savvy with the ability to quickly learn and adopt new digital tools.

• Strong project management and organisational skills.

• Professional attitude and ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.



GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

• Uphold company values, policies, and professional standards in all work.

• Maintain confidentiality of marketing strategies, client data, and internal information.

• Support the team with ad hoc tasks to ensure smooth workflow across the business.

• Maintain an organised and efficient digital and physical workspace.

• Continuously seek opportunities to improve marketing processes and systems.

• Contribute to a positive and collaborative team culture

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Hiring: Virtual Assistants (Part Time|Remote)
description:
We are a fast growing remote short form content agency. We are a small team that is expanding and we are looking for dependable people who want to grow with us long term.



This opportunity is suited for individuals who enjoy structured work, learning new systems, and supporting different parts of a digital business. 



Apart from good to excellent English skills, we are not looking for a specific skill set. We care more about attitude, reliability, responsiveness, and a willingness to learn.



AVAILABILITY



This role requires availability Monday through Saturday within the following general time windows based on Philippines time.



- Morning to early afternoon approximately 9:30 AM to 2:00 PM

- Evening approximately 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM



Exact hours may vary slightly and will be clarified later. Flexibility within these windows is important.



ABOUT THE WORK



We are bringing on tea
mbers to support several areas of the business. No prior experience is required. Full training and clear systems will be provided.



You should be interested in the following types of work:



1. Scriptwriter - Writing short form video scripts for fitness coaches

2. Quality Assurance (QA) - Reviewing content to ensure accuracy, clarity, and alignment with client standards

3. Ideation - Researching content ideas, hooks, and trends across social platforms

4. Video Editing - Editing short form videos following provided guidelines and brand standards



REQUIREMENTS



- Strong English communication skills

- Very responsive and reliable on WhatsApp

- Able to learn quickly and follow systems

- Comfortable with technology

- Familiar with or open to learning tools such as Notion, Google Sheets, and similar tools.

- Able to work independently using provided training, systems, and documentation.



COMPENSATION



- The position starts with a paid internship period lasting approximately 2 to 4 weeks

- During this phase, hours are tracked hourly at a starting rate of PHP 120 per hour

- After training, your hourly rate will increase as you gain experience. Over time, if we work well together, the rate may transition to a fixed monthly salary. The exact rate will be discussed once training is completed.



HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please reply with the following information.



1. Your WhatsApp number

2. Confirmation that you are available during the listed time windows

3. A short paragraph on why you would be a good fit for this role

4. One (1) preferred role and one (1) backup role only from the types of work listed above in case your first choice does not have an opening.

5. The smartphone model you use

6. The laptop model you use

7. A Google Drive link containing a screenshot of your internet speed test results (e.g. Speedtest). Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link.”



Thank you for your interest. We will review applications and contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Social Media Content Marketer (With Viral Reels Experience)
description:
**JOB OVERVIEW**

**Job type:** Part time, remote

**Hours:** 10 to 20 hours per week to start

**Pay:** Based on experience



I’m looking for a **game marketer** who has real experience growing video games on short form platforms like **TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts** (must have at least 2 years experience as a social media marketer).



This is a hands on, creative role where you’ll work directly with me to test content ideas, build traction, and help shape how the game shows up online.



This is ideal for someone who already understands how gaming content actually performs on short form platforms and wants ownership, not just execution.



## What you’ll work on



You’ll help with things like:



* Creating and publishing short form video content for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts

* Turning raw gameplay clips into high retention, scroll stopping posts

* Writing hooks, captions, and on screen text that fit gaming audiences

* Testing different content angles like devlogs, features, combat 
nts, humor, and behind the scenes

* Studying performance and adjusting content based on what actually works

* Helping shape a repeatable content format and posting system



I’ll share game context, roadmap, and footage. You’ll help turn that into content people actually want to watch.



## What I’m looking for



You don’t need to be a huge agency marketer, but you should have:



* Real experience marketing video games or gaming content on TikTok, Reels, or Shorts

* A strong feel for hooks, pacing, and retention in short form video

* Comfort editing short form videos or working directly with raw clips

* An understanding of gaming communities and what feels authentic vs promotional

* Clear written communication in English

* A testing mindset and comfort working without rigid scripts



## Nice to have, but not required



* Experience growing an indie game, early access title, or niche gaming community

* Familiarity with devlog style content

* Experience launching content for Steam wishlists or pre release campaigns



## Who this is perfect for



* Game marketers who already work with short form video

* Content creators who have helped grow a game or gaming brand

* Social media marketers who specialize in gaming audiences

* Indie focused marketers who like small teams and fast feedback loops



## How to apply



Please include:



* A short intro about you

* Your experience marketing games or gaming content

* Links to TikTok, Reels, or Shorts you’ve worked on

* Your role in those projects

* Your availability per week



If you’ve helped an indie game, personal project, or small gaming creator grow through short form content, I care far more about that.

title: Customer Service Representative (Social Media Moderation)
description:
Company: Simply Nootropics

Location: Remote

Position Type: Full-Time



About Us:



Simply Nootropics is a fast-growing supplement e-commerce company based in New Zealand. We specialise in scientifically formulated supplements and nootropics that support longevity, anti-ageing, brain health, stress management, and cognitive performance. Our customers are primarily based in New Zealand, Australia, Singapore, and increasingly across Europe and the USA. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional customer service and high-quality products that truly impact lives. Our team is hardworking, supportive, and fun, we believe in getting great results together.



The role



We’re hiring a Customer Service Representative with a social-media background. This is a hands-on, customer-first role: you’ll be the frontline for our global customers, managing a high daily ticket volume, resolving international shipping and customs challenges, and monitoring order fulfillment to keep customers informed and satisfied. While the core focus is customer support, social media is a complementary part of the job - you’ll manage comments, DMs and community posts on Meta 
 & Instagram), escalate social issues when needed, and help maintain a consistent brand voice. This position suits a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced e-commerce environment, works independently with minimal supervision, and enjoys improving processes and outcomes.



Key responsibilities



- Own daily customer inquiries (80+ tickets/day) across
, tickets, and live chat in Gorgias.

- Respond to and manage comments, DMs, and community posts on
 & Instagram (Meta/Business Suite); escalate or route issues when needed.

- Manage review platforms - monitor, respond to, and escalate reviews across Trustpilot, Google Reviews, and on-site (website) reviews. This includes:

- Responding promptly and professionally to positive and negative reviews.

- Requesting reviews and follow-up feedback where appropriate (Trustpilot, CSTAT, site surveys).

- Tracking sentiment and recurring review themes, and escalating product/policy issues to Ops/Marketing/Product.

- Proposing templates/macros and workflows specifically for review responses to ensure consistent brand voice and compliance.

- Monitor daily fulfillment status in Shopify (or the relevant fulfillment/dashboard tools), identify fulfillment exceptions, and report backlogs or fulfillment issues to Operations/Logistics as required.

- Process refunds, returns, exchanges and order edits within policy; document exceptions and edge cases.

- Troubleshoot and resolve international shipping, duties, and customs issues for cross-border orders.

- Work with Shopify, SKIO and inventory tools to investigate orders and fulfillments.

- Escalate product, logistics, or policy issues to Ops/Logistics/Product and follow through to resolution.



Requirements:



- Gorgias or Zendesk experience (must have).

- Proven ability to handle 80+ tickets/day in a fast-paced e-commerce setting.

- 3+ years customer service experience in e-commerce, with a background in supplements, health products, or related categories preferred.

- Hands-on experience with Shopify, Gorgias, SKIO, and inventory/fulfillment tools.

- Experience managing review platforms such as Trustpilot and Google Reviews, and moderating on-site website reviews.

- Excellent written and spoken English with strong customer-facing communication and problem-solving skills.

- Reliable computer (fast processor) and stable high-speed internet - proof required.

- Prior community management or social media moderation for brand channels 
/Instagram/Tiktok).

- Familiarity with Meta Business Suite, Tiktok and social inboxes.

- Experience replying to Trustpilot/Google/review platforms.

- Proactively drives solutions and operates with a high degree of autonomy.

- Experience moderating website reviews 

- Willingness to complete skill tests as part of the hiring process.



How to Apply



Please send your resume, a short cover note highlighting your Gorgias, Meta, review-platform, and fulfillment-dashboard experience, and (optional) examples or screenshots of social replies, review replies, macros, SOPs, or fulfillment reports you created. Candidates must be willing to complete a short skills test.



Why Join Us?



Work remotely from anywhere 

Opportunity for long-term growth.

Be part of a fun, supportive, international team.

Play a key role in shaping customer happiness and loyalty in a fast-growing company.





Join Simply Nootropics and make a real impact in the lives of our customers while advancing your career in a dynamic, global team.

title: Forex Analyst / EA Trader (Entry-Level)
description:
About Us

ImperiumEQ is a forward-thinking financial firm leveraging market insights and advanced trading strategies to maximize returns. Visit our website at ImperiumEQ.



Job Description

As a Forex Analyst / EA Trader at ImperiumEQ, you will focus on the research, development, testing, optimization, and monitoring of automated trading systems (Expert Advisors). This role is centered on algorithmic and AI-assisted trading, not manual trade execution.

You will analyze market conditions, evaluate strategy performance, and continuously improve automated systems using data, backtesting, forward testing, and AI platforms.



Key Responsibilities

• Research and analyze forex market conditions to identify opportunities for automated trading strategies

• Develop, optimize, and manage Expert Advisors (EAs)

• Conduct backtesting and forward testing of trading strategies to evaluate performance and risk

• Monitor live EA performance and adjust parameters as needed

• Set up, manage, and maintain VPS environments for uninterrupted EA operation

• Analyze trading data, drawdowns, and performance metrics to improve system efficiency

• Utilize AI platforms and tools to enhance strategy development, optimization, and market analysis

• Integrate and manage
 bots, alerts, and reporting systems for trade monitoring and performance updates

• Maintain detailed records of strategy logic, testing results, and live performance

• Collaborate with the team to refine automated strategies and risk management frameworks

• Stay updated with new AI tools, automation techniques, and algorithmic trading trends



Skills & Qualifications

• Strong analytical and quantitative skills

• Solid understanding of forex market structure, price action, and economic drivers

• Proven experience working with Expert Advisors (EAs)

• Experience in EA research, optimization, backtesting, and forward testing

• Proficiency in using and managing VPS for automated trading

• Strong understanding of risk management for automated systems

• Experience using AI platforms for market analysis, strategy optimization, or automation

• Familiarity with
 bots, alerts, and automation workflows

• Proficiency with trading platforms (e.g., MT4/MT5) and related tools

• Detail-oriented with strong documentation and reporting skills

• Ability to work independently in a remote, flexible environment



Preferred Qualifications

• Basic understanding of algorithmic or systematic trading concepts

• Familiarity with EA logic and how trading bots work (MQL4/MQL5 or similar)

• Awareness of APIs, automation tools, or AI-based analytics (hands-on experience not required)

• Background or interest in finance, data analysis, or related fields (self-study is acceptable)

• Continuous learning mindset with interest in AI, automation, and quantitative trading



Why Join Us?

• Opportunity to work remotely with a flexible schedule.

• Be part of a dynamic, tech-forward team that embraces automation, AI, and innovation.

• Contribute to a company that values your expertise and offers opportunities for growth and development.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about automated forex trading, Expert Advisors, and data-driven strategies, and eager to make a significant impact within our team. If you thrive in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment and have a strong skill set in EA research, testing, optimization, and AI-assisted analysis, we would love to hear from you!

title: Amazon Compliance Specialist
description:
Regulatory & Legal Compliance



Conduct in-depth research on FDA, EPA, FTC, and other relevant federal and state regulations.

Ensure compliance with international product safety standards (EU, UK, Canada, Asia-Pacific) when applicable.

Perform ongoing monitoring of regulatory updates and interpret implications for product categories.

Support intellectual property due diligence to prevent patent, copyright, or trademark infringement.



Risk Management & Product Compliance



Evaluate new and existing products for compliance risks and advise stakeholders on mitigation strategies.

Develop compliance testing protocols and coordinate with third-party labs and certification agencies.

Manage corrective actions, recalls, or withdrawals in alignment with Amazon’s policies and legal requirements.

Conduct audits of product listings and seller submissions to prevent unlawful or restricted product selection.



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Partner with Legal, Product Development, Supply Chain, and Seller Performance teams to execute compliance initiatives.

Provide clear guidance to vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on compliance requirements.

Train cross-functional stakeholders on compliance best practices and emerging regulatory risks.

Act as a subject matter expert to business teams during product launches, regulatory reviews, and inspections.



Policy & Process Development



Draft and implement compliance procedures, standard operating protocols (SOPs), and escalation processes.

Support automation and system-based compliance controls to scale monitoring and enforcement.

Contribute to internal policy development regarding restricted products, product claims, and safety certifications.

Continuously improve workflows to enhance accuracy, timeliness, and audit readiness.



Documentation & Reporting



Maintain accurate records of compliance assessments, approvals, and regulatory correspondence.

Prepare detailed reports and risk assessments for leadership review.

Provide supervisors with regular feedback on task progress, emerging risks, and resolution status.

Ensure confidentiality of sensitive data, supplier information, and Amazon business strategy.





Experience interacting directly with regulators including federal and state agencies

Experience in research and analyzing federal and state regulations

Familiarity and experience in dealing with FDA regulation is REQUIRED

Familiarity with international compliance frameworks (REACH, RoHS, CE marking).

title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist (GoHighLevel)
description:
We are a real estate media and marketing company working with realtors in Ontario, Canada. We use a GoHighLevel-based CRM to support lead generation, client onboarding, and long-term relationship nurturing.



Our CRM is an active growth system, not a static database.



The Role



We’re looking for a hands-on CRM specialist to help build, refine, and evolve our GoHighLevel-based systems (PixlCRM / LeadConnector).



You’ll be involved in:

 • Building new CRM functions to support lead generation activities

 • Creating and refining workflows, landing pages, and nurture programs

 • Improving and maintaining existing automations as our marketing evolves



This is an execution role with ongoing iteration, not a one-time setup.



What You’ll Do

 • Build and optimize workflows and automations 
, SMS, internal logic)

 • Create and manage landing pages, forms, and lead capture flows

 • Support lead nurturing, onboarding, referral, and re-engagement programs

 • Maintain pipelines, tags, triggers, and custom fields

 • Refine and improve programs over time based on real-world use

 • Troubleshoot automation issues and clean up system complexity

 • Document workflows and changes clearly



What We’re Looking For

 • Hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or LeadConnector

 • Proven ability to build real-world CRM systems (not just templates)

 • Comfort working with evolving marketing strategies and requirements

 • Strong attention to detail and system logic

 • Ability to work independently and communicate clearly



Hours & Compensation

 • Part-time, permanent: ~10–20 hours/week to start

 • Fully remote

 • Flexible schedule (Ontario business hours helpful)

• 13th Month pay, in line with standard Philippine employment practices



How to Apply



Please include:

 • A brief summary of your GoHighLevel / LeadConnector experience

 • Examples of workflows, landing pages, or automations you’ve built

 • A reference to a purple elephant

 • A reference to RAFE05



Screening Question (Required)



Describe a CRM workflow or automation you built that had to be refined over time. What was the original goal, what didn’t work as expected, and how did you improve it?



Applications that don’t answer this question will not be considered.



-----



This role is not a fit for candidates who have only completed GoHighLevel tutorials or rely on pre-built funnel templates. We’re looking for someone who understands how CRM systems evolve alongside real marketing efforts.

title: Customer Support Specialist /Automotive Service Advisor
description:

About Workwise Auto Solutions:

At Workwise Auto Solutions, we’re revolutionising the way automotive workshops operate. Our mission is to empower shop owners with the tools and support they need to maximise profits, save time, and streamline operations without the headaches of disconnected systems and admin overload.

We specialise in Virtual Service Advisors (VSAs), highly trained professionals who take the pressure off workshop teams by handling customer communication, booking triage, job approvals, and workflow optimisation. Whether you're a Primary Virtual Service Advisor (directly handling client interactions) or an Auxiliary Virtual Service Advisor (supporting VSAs and handling Workwise admin tasks), you’ll play a key role in ensuring workshops run efficiently.

title: Content Editor & Production Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 



About the Role 

In Financial Services is a growing, award-winning mortgage brokerage building a strong digital presence through education-led video content distributed across multiple platforms, including YouTube and other digital channels. 



We’re looking for a Content Editor & Production Lead to own the full production of our video content - from raw footage through to final, publish-ready assets. 



Our content includes: 

>>Educational finance and property videos 

>>Trust-building client review and testimonial videos 

>>Short-form clips and video ad creatives 

>>Internal and client experience videos (e.g. updates, nurture campaigns) 



This is not a marketing strategy role and not a junior VA position. 



You’ll work closely with our Australian leadership and marketing team, taking approved content ideas and raw recordings and turning them into complete, production-ready content - including video edits, visuals, thumbnails, and uploads once approved. 



This role focuses on production ownership and execution excellence - supporting campaigns, ads, and client communications through high-quality content, while strategy, budgets, and performance optimisation sit with the marketing team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>Educational long-form videos are edited, packaged, and published consistently across approved platforms 

>>Client review videos are polished, authentic, and professionally presented 

>>Thumbnails are clear, on-brand, and designed to support engagement 

>>Short-form clips and video ads are efficiently produced from long-form content 

>>Content is uploaded accurately once approved, with correct titles, descriptions, and basic formatting 

>>The marketing team is freed up to focus on growth, partnerships, and client experience 

>>Our content library becomes a valuable long-term asset for the business 

 

Key Responsibilities 



Long-Form Educational & Client Video Production 

>>Edit long-form educational videos (for YouTube, podcasts and other approved platforms), interviews, and presentations 

>>Edit client review and testimonial videos to a professional, trustworthy standard 

>>Clean audio, remove dead space, tighten pacing, and structure content for clarity 

>>Apply consistent branding, chapters, lower thirds, titles, and visual standards 



Short-Form Content & Ad Creative 

>>Cut long-form education and client review content into short-form clips 

>>Produce dynamic video ad creatives using approved messaging, visuals, overlays, and supporting assets 

>>Take raw footage and create interesting and unique videos that perform well on TikTok/Instagram and META ads.  

>>Ensure all creatives align with brand tone and guidelines 



Thumbnails & Visual Assets 

>>Design thumbnails and supporting visual assets for videos and ads 

>>Maintain a consistent thumbnail style and branding 

>>Make revisions based on internal feedback (analytics ownership not required) 



Content Upload & Publishing Support 

>>Upload approved content to platforms (e.g. video platforms, ad platforms, social platfoms) 

>>Apply approved titles, descriptions, tags, chapters, and basic formatting 

>>Ensure content is published correctly and on schedule once approved 



Content Production Flow 

>>Manage the end-to-end production workflow from raw files ? published assets 

>>Maintain clear file naming, version control, and content organisation 

>>Work closely with the marketing team to meet publishing schedules 



Quality Control & Consistency 

>>Ensure all content meets quality and brand standards before publishing 

>>Maintain consistency across long-form, short-form, ads, and thumbnails 

>>Flag opportunities to improve production efficiency or quality 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong experience producing education-led long-form video content end to end for multiple platforms 

>>Experience editing client review or testimonial videos 

>>Experience creating thumbnails and simple video ad creatives 

>>Confident using professional editing tools (Premiere Pro, Capcut, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve, or similar) 

>>Comfortable creating thumbnails using tools such as Photoshop, Canva, or similar 

>>Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and clarity for educational content 

>>Excellent attention to detail and pride in clean, polished work 

>>Able to manage multiple projects without quality dropping 

>>Able to work independently on video production and confident to produce original ideas  



Highly Regarded (Not Essential): 

>>Experience creating video content that supports paid ads,
 campaigns, or client nurture journeys 

>>Experience working within content-led businesses where long-form video supports audience growth, trust, and client acquisition 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A content strategy or growth role 

(X) A paid ads management role 

(X) A performance analytics role 

(X) A junior VA position 



You’ll be responsible for production and delivery, not deciding what content to create or how campaigns perform. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian business 

2. Clear expectations and structured workflows 

3. Work alongside a collaborative offshore and Australian team 

4. Purpose-driven content focused on education and trust (not clickbait) 

5. Opportunity to grow with the business as content output scales 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for education, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and our content plays a key role in delivering that mission. 

 

Next Steps 

To apply, please include: 

>>Examples of long-form educational videos you’ve produced 

>>Examples of thumbnails and ad creatives you’ve created 

>>A brief summary of your content production experience 

>>Your expected monthly rate

title: Systems & Automation Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 

 

About the Role 

In Financial Services is building a highly systemised, automation-led mortgage business designed around an exceptional client experience. 



Our focus is on removing friction at every stage of the loan lifecycle. Systems, automation, and AI are used to quietly handle data flow, documentation, task creation, and handovers across the entire loan lifecycle - from first enquiry through to submission, approval, settlement, and long-term review - so our clients feel supported and confident, and our team can focus on advice, problem-solving, and outcomes. 



We’re looking for a Systems & Automation Lead to work closely with the leadership team and alongside our established, high-performing offshore team in the Philippines. 



This role owns how our systems operate day to day. You’ll identify opportunities, improve workflows, and help shape how automation and AI support both our clients and our internal teams as the business continues to scale. 



This is a hands-on execution role for someone who enjoys building clean systems, improving efficiency, and working as part of a connected, collaborative remote team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>A client enters the business via an enquiry, referral, or campaign. From there: 

>>Client information flows cleanly into GoHighLevel (GHL) and into Broker Engine without duplication 

>>Meetings are booked with accurate pre-filled client data 

>>Client documents are guided, collected, named, and stored correctly 

>>Submission, approval, settlement, and post-settlement steps are system-led and automated where possible 

>>Tasks, notes, and handovers are created automatically for brokers and processing teams 

>>Ongoing reviews and retention workflows trigger without manual follow-up 



From the client’s perspective, the process feels clear, organised, and easy. 

From the team’s perspective, files are structured, complete, and ready to progress at every stage. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

>>Own the build, optimisation, and ongoing improvement of workflows across Broker Engine and GoHighLevel (GHL) 

>>Design and maintain integrations between Broker Engine, GHL, document storage, compliance workflows, and other systems using automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Automate workflows across the full mortgage lifecycle, including lead intake, data capture, submission, approval, settlement, post-settlement, and ongoing review 

>>Embed AI and Copilot-style tools into workflows to support meeting summaries, task creation, file notes, quality checks, and handovers 

>>Ensure client data and documents are captured, named, and stored correctly to support a seamless client experience 

>>Create role-based task automation so brokers and processing teams work from systems, not memory 

>>Document systems and workflows clearly, including SOPs, process maps, and short training guides 

>>Maintain a backlog of system, automation, and AI improvements and support continuous optimisation 

>>Support system setup and integration for new hires and future loan book acquisitions 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong hands-on experience building and maintaining advanced workflows in GoHighLevel, including pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, calendars, and multi-step client journeys 

>>Experience working with Broker Engine or similar mortgage broker CRMs 

>>Experience working with system integrations, including API-based connections, webhooks, and automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Practical experience applying AI tools (such as Copilot) within structured, repeatable workflows 

>>Solid understanding of mortgage or financial services workflows, including submission and post-settlement stages 

>>Highly process-driven with strong attention to detail 

>>Able to build, document, and explain systems clearly 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A marketing or funnel optimisation role 

(X) A compliance interpretation role 

(X) A strategy-only role 



You’ll be executing approved solutions within clear systems and governance. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian brokerage 

2. Work alongside an established offshore team in the Philippines 

3. Dedicated systems role within the offshore team, working closely with Australian leadership 

3. Strong team culture with daily collaboration via Microsoft Teams 

4. Opportunities to work on meaningful automation and AI initiatives that improve real client outcomes 

5. Clear priorities, structured workflows, and high standards 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for excellence, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and we believe smart systems, automation, and great people working together make that possible. 

 

Next Steps 

If you enjoy building intelligent systems, embedding automation and AI into real workflows, and being part of a connected, high-performing remote team, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Amazon FBA Virtual Assistant - Online arbitrage and Wholesale
description:

Preparing detailed sourcing sheets with accurate profitability, ROI, and demand data

Following our approved sourcing methods and avoiding restricted websites

Following KPIs, hitting sourcing targets, and improving over time



 Requirements

Experience & Skills



MINIMUM 2 years UK market experience in online arbitrage

 Skilled with Keepa (deep product analysis)

 Skilled with SellerAmp (SAS)

 Good understanding of Amazon sales rank, competition, ROI, and profitability analysis)

 Experience working long-term with previous employers (minimum several months)

We want committed VAs who grow with us, take pride in their work, and deliver consistent results.

title: Virtual RN (Remote) — Pre-Visit Planning, Chart Review, Quality Care Gaps (CQV), CPT II Coding & Prior Authorizations
description:
We’re hiring a detail-oriented Virtual Registered Nurse (RN) to support an internal medicine primary care practice with pre-visit planning, chart review, clinical quality validation (CQV), CPT II coding for care gaps, and prior authorizations. This role is focused on strengthening documentation, improving quality measure capture, and reducing administrative burden on the clinical team—while maintaining excellent standards for accuracy and HIPAA compliance.



Key Responsibilities

1) Pre-Visit Planning & Chart Review



Perform comprehensive chart review before scheduled visits (new + established patients).



Build pre-visit documentation and structured summaries for the provider/team, including:



Relevant history, active problems, and recent specialist updates



Recent labs/imaging and what’s due next



Preventive care needs and chronic disease monitoring opportunities



Flag missing documentation items that impact visit efficiency or quality capture.



2) Clinical Quality Validation (CQV) + Care Gap Support



Perform clinical quality validation (CQV) using payer quality portals/websites (as applicable) to confir
asure status and identify gaps.



Identify and track care gaps (screenings, chronic disease measures, immunizations, monitoring labs) and support closure documentation through established clinic workflows.



Ensure documentation supports quality measures appropriately (clear dates, results, and proof of completion).



Maintain internal tracking for CQV tasks and measure status updates.



3) CPT II Coding for Quality Measures



Apply/assist with CPT II coding for quality reporting and care gap documentation per clinic protocol.



Ensure CPT II codes are supported by chart documentation and entered consistently.



Help reduce missed quality capture by identifying where documentation exists but wasn’t coded.



4) Prior Authorizations & Medication Access Support



Initiate and manage prior authorizations for medications, diagnostics, and procedures as assigned.



Compile required documentation (clinical notes, relevant labs, prior treatment history).



Track PA status, follow payer timelines, and escalate barriers to the team as needed.



Support appeals when requested and within workflow.



5) Documentation, Communication & Workflow Support



Maintain accurate documentation and logs for:



Pre-visit planning completion



Care gaps/CQV findings and actions taken



CPT II codes applied



Prior authorization submissions and outcomes



Communicate efficiently with the provider/clinic team via EHR tasks, secure messaging, or agreed workflow.



Maintain HIPAA-compliant handling of all PHI and work from a secure, private environment.





Required Qualifications: 



Outpatient experience (primary care/internal medicine/family medicine preferred).



Strong understanding of preventive care and chronic disease monitoring workflows.



Hands-on experience with prior authorizations and working across payer portals.



Comfort with structured documentation and quality-related chart review.



Preferred Qualifications:



Familiarity with CPT II codes and quality measure documentation.



Experience performing quality portal validation (CQV) and care gap workflows.



Strong EHR experience (Epic preferred if applicable, not required).



Prior remote work experience or demonstrated ability to self-manage and meet deadlines.



Skills & Traits



Highly organized, dependable, and detail-oriented



Clear, concise communicator



Efficient and consistent with documentation



Understands scope and follows established protocols



Comfortable working independently while staying aligned with team workflow



Work Environment & Expectations



Remote/virtual position



Must have reliable internet, secure workspace, and ability to maintain privacy for PHI



Must meet turnaround times for pre-visit planning and PA follow-up



Works closely with the provider/team to reduce missed care gaps and improve visit readiness

title: Client Care Captain – Real Estate Operations & Client Experience
description:
This role exists to remove stress, confusion, and operational noise from a growing real estate business.



The Client Care Captain owns the client experience from contract to close and ensures calm, clarity, and consistency at every step.



This is not a task role.

This is an ownership role.



Who This Role Is For:

* This role is ideal for someone who:

* Loves structure

* Stays calm under pressure

* Is proud of consistency

* Is comfortable enforcing process

* Enjoys responsibility

* Values long-term stability



We are looking for someone who wants to build alongside us, take responsibility for outcomes, and be part of something they can be proud of over time.



What You Will Own

* You will be fully responsible for:

* Client communication ownership

* Transaction timeline ownership

* Agent support and accountability

* Process consistency and continuous improvement

* Escalation filtering

* You are the steady center of the operation.

* When this role is done well, everyone feels calmer and more focused.



What Success Looks Like

* Few or zero emergencies

* Clients feel informed and calm

* Agents stay focused on their strengths

* Leadership is rarely pulled into day-to-day operations



Qualifications and Expectations

* Strong written and verbal English communication

* High attention to detail and follow-through

* Comfortable owning outcomes and enforcing process

* Reliable, consistent, and organized

* Experience in operations, client care, or real estate transactions is a plus, but not required

* Character, judgment, and ownership matter more than titles.



When successful in this role, you will have:

* Long-term role with stability and growth potential

* Performance-based bonuses may be added over time based on quality and consistency

* This role is designed to be sustainable, respected, and trusted.



Your compensation will:

Start at $1,500 for the first 60 days

Automatically raise to $1,650 after successful probation



How to Apply



To apply, please include:

* A short introduction explaining why this role fits you

* One example of a system you helped run smoothly

* Confirmation of availability during EST working hours and reliable internet



Optional but strongly preferred:

Please include a short video (1–2 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining how you stay calm and organized when managing multiple responsibilities. This does not need to be polished. We are simply looking to understand how you communicate and think.



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.



Final Note



This role is central to how we grow calmly, profitably, and with integrity.



If you take pride in structure, ownership, and helping others feel confident through clear systems, this may be the most meaningful role you’ve had.

title: Social Media Design & Marketing Virtual Assistant
description:

/in/minudatta

I'm looking for someone to join my company, MD Coaching & Consulting LLC. We focus on executive coaching and leadership development, and I'm actively building my LinkedIn presence to reach accomplished tech executives.



About Meenu

Meenu is an ICF-certified Executive and Leadership Coach specializing in working with mid-senior tech leaders.

She has 20+ years of Fortune 500 tech experience at companies like NetApp, Cisco, Target, Kaiser Permanente, etc.

She now coaches senior leaders 1:1 globally and also runs the Leadership Edge Accelerator program.

Meenu has been scaling her LinkedIn presence to reach and engage with accomplished tech executives.

Meenu is committed to her tea
mbers developing and improving, and always wants to provide an amazing work experience.



Your role:

1. Post agreed copy and assets on LinkedIn

Publish scheduled content according to content calendar

Format posts properly with appropriate spacing and structure

Ensure all assets are correctly uploaded and display properly



2. Community Management on LinkedIn

Engage with comments on my posts with thoughtful responses that stimulate discussion and encourage people to comment back

Comment on 35+ relevant posts daily at 7:30 am - 9:30 am ET (targeting tech leadership and executive coaching audiences)

Comments should be substantive and aimed at stimulating discussion

Monitor and respond to direct messages professionally

Track engagement metrics and provide weekly reports



3. Newsletter Management & Leads Tracking 

Manage newsletter platform (Kit)

Schedule and send newsletters according to content calendar

Track subscriber metrics and engagement

Maintain organized contact lists for LinkedIn leads and Newsletter

Provide regular reports on newsletter performance

Set up and manage lead magnets (quizzes, assessments, downloads) when needed

Track and report on lead generation metrics on LinkedIn



4. Content Support

Research relevant topics in existing content pillars of leadership, mindset, etc.

Assist with content repurposing (turning long-form content into shorter posts)

Organize content library and assets

Support with basic graphic needs using Canva or similar tools

Experience designing carousels and infographics is a plus (templates will be provided)



5. Administrative Support (as needed)

Manage scheduling and calendar coordination as needed

Support client onboarding processes

Maintain organized files and documentation



Key & Essential Skills

Strong written English communication skills (this is critical)

Very strong attention to detail and fast learner

Understanding of LinkedIn and professional social media engagement

Positive "can do" attitude and willingness to learn

Self-motivated and reliable

Previous experience with social media management or VA work preferred

Familiarity with LinkedIn, Canva, Kit, and AI tools is a must



Pay

$800+ a month for full-time work (40+ hours/week). I am looking for a full-time employee.

If the candidate is successful, there will be opportunities for pay raises and bonuses depending on performance.



Perks

You control your own time. As long as you have a few hours online around 7:30 am - 9:30 am ET for LinkedIn engagement and 1-2 hours per week for regular syncs.

Flexible vacation time: If you need time off, just book it a week in advance

Opportunity to learn about the coaching industry and work with a values-driven business



Applying for the job:

Apply on the portal first.

Write 3-5 sentences about why you would like this position and why you are a good fit (no AI responses, please)

Focus on education, work experience, and LinkedIn (engagement, content creation, design visuals like Carousels, Infographics, etc., LinkedIn inbox management, outreach, tracking the outreach and follow up and collect metrics). 



Under that, include the following (use the letters to make it easy for me to read):

Number of years experience with written English and LinkedIn (Recent LinkedIn experience of minimum 2 years is a must)

What software you have used for
/newsletter management

What tools you have used for creative/design work

Please include your CV and examples of social media work if available.



Make sure you follow these steps as we often receive applications and being organized is critical. We are looking for a tea
mber for the long term and will offer raises and bonuses based on performance as we grow. Therefore, I will only look at applicants who really want the role.



If you are invited to the interview stage, there will be a written task that will be paid.

If successful at this stage, there will be a short video call between us and video and spoken English will be required. Don't worry if you are shy - I value authenticity over polish!



Thank you for reading the application.

Meenu Datta

title: APS Consulting Recruitment Notice
description:
APS Consulting is a Sydney-based advisory firm providing comprehensive strategic consulting services to clients worldwide. As we continue to expand our global footprint, we are seeking experienced Overseas Consultants with strong expertise in government relations, and a deep understanding of political affairs, economics, law, and public policy.



Scope of Work and Responsibilities  

Consultants in this role primarily support research, policy analysis, and advisory work related to overseas political, regulatory, and governance developments. Typical tasks include:



Conducting background research and policy monitoring



Stakeholder mapping and engagement analysis



Drafting analytical briefs and memos



Supporting scenario planning and risk assessments for client decision-making



Types of Clients and Projects  

Our clients generally include private enterprises, professional institutions, and organizations with cross-border interests that require an informed understanding of overseas political, regulatory, or public-sector environments. Projects are research- and analysis-driven, and may relate to:



Public policy trends



Government processes



Geopolitical risk assessments



Work Structure (approximately 20 hours per week)  

This is a flexible, part-time consultancy arrangement. Work is typically project-based, with weekly hours varying depending on deliverables and timelines. Coordination is conducted remotely, and schedules are discussed in advance to align with both project requirements and consultant availability.



Preferred Backgrounds  

Candidates with prior experience in the following sectors will be given priority consideration:



Government or public administration



Law firms or legal advisory institutions



Media or strategic communications organizations



Think tanks or research institutions



Consulting or public relations firms



Non-governmental or international organizations



Compensation and Benefits  

We offer competitive compensation packages and flexible work arrangements tailored to global professionals.



Application  

For inquiries or application submission, please contact us at:





Or visit our website:

title: Social Media Account Manager
description:
Apply Here

Start your application here: 
 



Compensation and Benefits

Salary: USD $500–$700 per month (based on experience)

Full-time position

2 days Paid Time Off (PTO) per month after successful completion of the 30-day trial period

Monthly KPI-based performance bonuses

Long-term role with career growth opportunities



Work Schedule

Shift: 7:00 AM – 3:00 PM (Manila time)

8 hours per day

6 days per week



About the Role

We are a digital marketing agency looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Social Media Manager to join our team.

This role involves creating, managing, and growing multiple social media accounts across platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and
/X (Threads). You will handle daily posting, follow platform best practices, track performance, and help accounts grow organically.

This position is ideal for someone who is organized, comfortable managing multiple accounts, and able to maintain consistent daily output.



Key Responsibilities

Create and manage social media accounts across multiple platforms

Plan and execute daily content posting schedules

Develop platform-specific posting and growth strategies

Monitor account performance and optimize content accordingly

Maintain organized records of account credentials and metrics

Ensure accounts follow natural and authentic growth patterns

Apply best practices for account security and scaling

Perform basic video editing using CapCut



Technical Requirements

Personal computer dedicated for work use only (not shared during shifts)

Ability to run time-tracking software (Gastime, DeskTime, or equivalent)

Knowledge of proxy usage for account management

Stable high-speed internet connection

Backup internet connection for outages

Basic troubleshooting skills

Experience using social media management tools

Basic proficiency in CapCut for video editing



Required Qualifications

Strong English communication skills (high B to C level)

Proven experience managing multiple social media accounts

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Good technical skills with computers and mobile devices

Reliable and punctual

Experience using Apple devices (MacBooks and iPhones)



Preferred Qualifications

Experience with social media growth strategies

Knowledge of content curation and platform best practices

Familiarity with social media analytics

Ability to adapt to frequent platform updates and algorithm changes

Experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously



Professional Development

Training on social media growth strategies and platform algorithms

Hands-on experience with proven multi-platform growth methods

Ongoing learning and upskilling

Career advancement opportunities within the agency

title: Sales Operations Manager – Messaging Team (Remote)
description:
How to Apply

To apply, please complete this form: 
 



We are seeking an experienced Sales Operations Manager to lead messaging-based sales and engagement teams for client accounts. This role focuses on revenue performance, team efficiency, and operational execution, while maintaining fast response times and high-quality audience engagement.



You will oversee supervisors and messaging agents, monitor daily performance metrics, and ensure smooth, secure account operations.



Work Setup: Remote

Reports To: COO

Team Managed: Messaging Supervisors & Engagement Agents



Key Responsibilities

- Operations & Performance

- Manage daily messaging sales operations across multiple accounts

- Monitor and improve key metrics: Revenue per Hour (RevPH), Replies per Minute (RPM), response time (sub-2.5 minutes)

- Perform daily account health checks: income, resubscribe rates, revenue per fan, and chargebacks

- Identify operational issues early and implement corrective actions

- Execute monthly initiatives with clearly defined KPIs

- Team Management

- Lead Messaging Supervisors and engagement teams

- Evaluate supervisor traffic and inbox management performance

- Handle hiring, training, performance reviews, and terminations

- Review individual agent performance (speed, response quality, and task handling)

- Maintain accountability while keeping team morale high

- Quality, Security & Reporting

- Enforce engagement quality standards while meeting speed and sales targets

- Implement chargeback prevention and audience-blocking protocols

- Ensure account security, notification compliance, and platform rules

- Submit accurate End-of-Day (EOD) performance reports



Qualifications

- Required Experience

- Minimum 2 years of team leadership experience in a performance-driven environment

- Background in messaging-based sales, customer engagement, or online sales

- Experience with creator platforms or subscription-based digital products is a strong advantage

- Skills & Traits

- Strong people management and coaching skills

- Data-driven mindset with confidence in performance metrics

- Clear communicator with firm but fair leadership style

- Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities

- Detail-oriented with a strong focus on compliance and security

title: Youtube Video Editor
description:
Job Description:

We are looking for a talented and detail-oriented video editor to help create high-quality, engaging videos. The ideal candidate should have experience working with raw footage from phone recordings and be able to enhance content through expert editing, seamless transitions, and creative additions.



What You'll Do:

1. Tailored Workflow & Enhanced Quality: Optimize raw footage with noise reduction, audio leveling, and effects to elevate overall content quality.

2. Precise Editing & Efficiency: Edit and enhance videos while ensuring quick turnaround times without compromising quality.

3. Professional Video Editing: Deliver precise and creative edits to match the project’s needs.

4. Post-Production: Provide comprehensive post-production services to ensure polished, professional results.

5. Color Correction: Apply color grading and correction to enhance the visual appeal of videos.

6. Sound Design: Add background music, improve audio quality, and create an immersive audio experience.

7. Creative Storytelling: Make decisions on where to insert B-rolls, animations, zoom transitions, and graphics to make videos more engaging.

8. Subtitles & Captions: Add subtitles for accessibility and engagement.

9. Organizing Clips & Footage: Structure videos from beginning to end with a seamless flow.

10. Transitions & Video Effects: Implement smooth transitions and effects for a professional touch.

11. Intro & Outro: Create engaging intros and outros to enhance brand identity.

12. Multiple Revisions: Open to feedback and revisions to achieve the desired final product.



Ideal Candidate:



- Experienced in editing phone-recorded content

- Creative and detail-oriented

- Understands sound design and background music selection

- Proficient in color grading and correction

- Skilled in using professional video editing software (Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, etc.)

- Efficient and deadline-driven



If you're passionate about video editing and can transform raw footage into engaging, high-quality content, we'd love to hear from you!



To apply, please send:

1. Examples of past video editing work

2. Are you willing to sign an NDA before getting the materials to edit?

3. Your typical turnaround time for a 3-5 minute video

4. Are you willing to create a short sample? We will provide raw footage for the test.

et once per quarter to hang out with each other, go to the pool, enjoy.  I care about my team and feel like my team is almost my family.  We are all super friendly, hard-working, and looking for our next SUPERSTAR to help grow our business!

Noah Mencia
