title: Operations Assistant
description:
Operations Assistant (Outsourced / Remote)

Reporting to: Chief Operating Officer

 Location: Remote (Offshore)

 Engagement: Full-time / Long-term Contract

 Industry: Digital Assets / Hedge Fund / Financial Services



Role Overview

This is a high-trust, high-autonomy operations role supporting the COO across the execution of day-to-day business operations. The Operations Assistant acts as an extension of the COO — taking loosely defined problems, determining what needs to be done, and driving them to completion with minimal supervision. This is not a task-taking role. It is an ownership role. You will be expected to operate independently, manage ambiguity, and close operational loops without constant direction.



Core Responsibilities

Operational Execution & Ownership



Take ownership of operational tasks delegated by the COO and execute them end-to-end. Translate high-level or loosely defined requests into clear actions. Anticipate dependencies, blockers, and follow-ups without being prompted.

Close loops and confirm completion rather than leaving tasks half-done.



Accounts, Counterparties & Exchanges

Open and manage accounts with exchanges, custodians, banks, brokers, and service providers. Coordinate onboarding documentation, KYC, KYB, and account setup. Track onboarding status, outstanding items, access credentials, and approvals.

Maintain a clear inventory of active counterparties and access points.



KYC & Compliance Operations

Track KYC refresh requirements across exchanges, counterparties, and vendors. Proactively manage document updates, renewals, and submissions. Maintain structured, up-to-date repositories of corporate and personal KYC materials.

Ensure KYC records are complete, consistent, and audit-ready.



Board & Governance Operations

Support post-board and committee meeting execution and follow-through. Maintain a centralized board action log covering actions, owners, deadlines, and status. Chase internal and external stakeholders for overdue actions where appropriate.

Prepare clean post-meeting summaries highlighting open actions and next steps. Ensure board materials, minutes, resolutions, and action trackers are correctly filed, versioned, and accessible. Keep governance records organized and inspection-ready.



Investor & External Requests (Light Touch)

Support responses to routine investor or counterparty queries. Gather data, documents, and supporting materials as requested. Escalate matters requiring judgment, decisions, or approvals.



Data, Documentation & Systems Hygiene

Organize, clean, and maintain Google Drive and internal document repositories. Digitize and streamline operational documentation  Enforce consistent naming, version control, and folder structures. Ensure critical documents are easy to locate and clearly labeled.



Process Improvement & Automation

Identify inefficient, manual, or repetitive operational processes. Propose and implement improvements using automation or workflow tools where appropriate. Create simple SOPs, checklists, or trackers once processes stabilize.

Improve operational clarity and reduce dependency on ad-hoc explanations.



Ad-hoc COO Support

Pull data, prepare summaries, and assist with operational analysis. Support one-off operational projects as they arise.

Handle frequent context switching without losing accuracy or follow-through. 



Required Experience & Skills

3+ years in operations, administration, or execution-focused roles. Experience working in fast-moving, loosely structured environments. Comfortable interacting with financial institutions, exchanges, and service providers.

Strong written English and clear, concise communication. Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

Confident using tools such as Google Drive, spreadsheets, and workflow tools. Able to work independently and manage competing priorities.



Strongly Preferred

Experience in hedge funds, crypto, fintech, or financial services. Prior remote or offshore role supporting senior management. Familiarity with KYC / KYB processes. Experience maintaining governance or compliance documentation.

title: Accountant / Bookkeeper
description:
Accountant / Bookkeeper

Location: Remote / Offshore

Reporting to: COO, CFO

Industry: Crypto Hedge Fund / Technology Investments



Role Overview

We are hiring a hands-on Accountant / Bookkeeping professional to own day-to-day bookkeeping and support core fund accounting and NAV reconciliation processes across a multi-entity, multi-currency group.

This is not a clerical or data-entry role. You will be responsible for maintaining clean, auditable books, supporting monthly closes, and contributing directly to hedge fund NAV reconciliations alongside internal stakeholders and external fund administrators.

The ideal candidate has executed a migration to Xero, is comfortable working with imperfect legacy data, and can operate independently in a regulated, detail-sensitive environment.



Core Accounting Responsibilities

Own bookkeeping across multiple entities from transaction level through monthly close





Perform bank, credit card, and expense reconciliations with no unreconciled balances carried forward





Maintain general ledger, journals, accruals, and supporting schedules





Prepare monthly P&L, balance sheet, and management reporting packs





Manage multi-currency transactions, FX revaluations, and intercompany expenses





Track operational costs, vendor payments, and recurring obligations





Prepare clean, well-supported financial records for external accountants, auditors, and tax advisors







Xero & Systems Responsibilities

Execute or lead migration from an existing accounting platform to Xero





Map and restructure chart of accounts where required





Migrate historical data and opening balances





Validate post-migration data integrity through full reconciliation





Ensure Xero is maintained in a clean, audit-ready state post go-live



Fund & NAV Support Responsibilities

Support monthly hedge fund NAV processes in coordination with fund administrators





Reconcile cash, expenses, fees, and internal records to administrator NAV reports





Assist in identifying, investigating, and resolving NAV breaks





Maintain working papers supporting management fees, performance fees, and expense allocations





Prepare clear, defensible schedules to support internal review and NAV sign-off



Required Experience & Skills

3–5+ years of hands-on bookkeeping or accounting experience





Direct responsibility for migrating an accounting system to Xero, including data migration and reconciliation





Experience working in multi-entity and multi-currency environments





Exposure to fund accounting or hedge fund NAV processes, either in-house or alongside a fund administrator





Strong understanding of core accounting principles and controls





High attention to detail with strong reconciliation discipline





Able to work independently, prioritise effectively, and meet recurring reporting deadlines





Clear, professional English communication skills



Nice to Have

Experience in hedge funds, investment firms, fintech, or technology companies





Exposure to crypto-related accounting environments (wallets, custodians, fiat on/off-ramps; non-trading)





Experience working with offshore or internationally distributed teams



Not a Fit If

Your experience is limited to basic bookkeeping without ownership of close or reconciliations





You have not worked with multi-entity or multi-currency structures





You have never supported fund accounting or NAV-related processes

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach Assistant (Part-Time, Contractor) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I’m the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You’ll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:

   

        - Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

        - Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



            - brands vs retailers/stockists

            - competitors vs wholesale accounts

            - boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



-  Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1–2 minute Loom video explaining why you’re interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

title: Telemarketers/Cold Callers
description:
Your skills and time are needed by my company to help me reach potential clients at an affordable rate.



Please let me know if you are available to work 4-8-12 hour shifts from Monday - Friday



When hospices do not have nurses available to take care of their dying patient's they call companies like mine to ask us to send nurses 24 hours a day for a few days while their patient's are dying. We then send nurses for 8 hour shifts to the patient's and the nurses alternate so that we can provide the hospice patients with 24 hours of continuous care for the few days at the end of a patient's life.



The right candidate will be able to cold call Hospices in Southern California (United States) from a list of hospices I have, and attempt to get them to sign a contract so that my company can provide them with nursing services.



Please let Ella/Kathy know if you are available to work and interested in the opportunity via
 at 
 availability is from 12PM-12AM Mon-Fri CA time (3AM-3PM Manila time)



Subject line: Hire me





Thanks,



Jared Larner, LVN; CEO & Founder

(818)
HOSPICE ALLIANCE NETWORK

title: Creative Strategist (DTC Performance Creative)
description:
Type: Full-time or Part-time (contract-to-hire OK)



Works with: Founder, Media Buyer, Video Editor, Designer



Primary channels: Meta 
/Instagram) + landing page / advertorial funnel



What you’ll own

- You’ll own end-to-end creative strategy for paid social: customer research ? messaging angles ? creative briefs ? AI statics production ? iteration based on performance.



Responsibilities



Market + customer research

- Research competitors, offers, funnels, and creative patterns

- Build customer avatar docs (pain points, desired outcomes, objections, language)

- Extract “winning hooks” and angles from ads, reviews, Reddit, comments, etc.



Creative ideation + direction

- Generate weekly/monthly creative roadmap (themes, angles, concepts)

- Write clear briefs for static + video (hook, structure, scenes, b-roll, overlays, CTA)

- Develop testing matrices (angle x hook x format x offer)



Copywriting

- Draft / improve landing page copy, advertorial copy, and quiz copy

- Write short-form ad copy (primary text, headlines, descriptions) and script outlines



Creative production (AI statics)

- Generate static concepts using AI tools (Midjourney / Nano Banana / OpenAI image, etc.)

- Ensure brand consistency (palette, font style, layout discipline)

- Deliver ready-to-launch assets to the editor/designer



Collaboration

- Work daily/weekly with the video editor and designer to execute briefs fast

- Provide clear feedback based on performance and brand guidelines



Performance iteration

- Review results (thumbstop/CTR/CPC/CPA/CVR) and propose next tests

- Kill/scale creative based on data and learning, not opinions





What “good” looks like in 30 days

- You deliver a clear creative testing plan and run weekly cycles

- You ship consistent briefs and assets without hand-holding

- Creative velocity increases (more variants, better structure, faster iteration)



Requirements

- Proven performance creative experience for DTC (Meta is a must)

- Strong copy instincts (hooks, objections, offers, landing pages)

- Ability to produce AI statics (or willingness to learn fast)

- Organized: can run creative testing like a system

- Comfortable working async with clear deliverables



Nice to have

- Experience with quiz funnels + advertorial funnels

- Direct-response editing instincts (UGC pacing, pattern interrupts)

- Understanding of compliance in sensitive categories (if applicable)



Deliverables you’ll produce

- Weekly creative plan + angle library

- 10–30 static variants/week (depending on scope)

- 5–15 video briefs/week

- Landing page + advertorial + quiz copy drafts/iterations

title: Opera Teacher / Vocal Coach
description:
Hi! My name is Joseph, and I'd like to learn to be a better singer, for karaoke and to sing better at Church.



I'm looking for a person (preferably male baritone) who can video call me and teach me to sing. Looking ideally for someone with good experience in Classical vocal techniques, specifically to help my baritone voice be able to properly reach tenor notes with a well-supported mixed voice.



I already have plenty of vocal warmups and exercises. What I’m looking for is someone who can immediately identify what’s happening physically and acoustically when I sing, especially with:



Soft palate position



Resonance placement



Throat / laryngeal tension



Vowel modification



Chest ? mix ? head coordination



Please upload a video of yourself singing. Thank you

This is not a generic VA role. You will be working closely with me to research, organize, test, document, and execute real tasks that move a product toward launch.

You do not need prior SaaS or coding experience. You do need to be intelligent, detail oriented, and eager to learn.

________________________________________



Who This Role Is Perfect For

• You enjoy learning new systems

• You take pride in doing things correctly

• You want a long term working relationship, not quick gigs

________________________________________



Who Should Not Apply

• Anyone unwilling to learn new tools

________________________________________



Compensation & Growth

• Paid weekly

• Raises based on performance, reliability, and initiative

• Long term opportunity for increased responsibility and pay

________________________________________



How to Apply (Important)

2. Your current location and time zone

3. Your internet reliability (briefly)

4. A short written response to this question:

Explain a time you had to learn something completely new and how you approached it.

Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.

________________________________________



Final Note

I value clarity, honesty, and execution. If you do good work, communicate well, and take ownership of tasks, this role can grow with you.

title: Amazon Affiliate Website Manager
description:
Position Description

Job Title: Amazon Affiliate Website Manager

Company: Logic Minds 

Location: Remote – Philippines (Work from Home)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Remuneration: Negotiable

________________________________________

Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Amazon Affiliate Website Manager to set up, manage, and grow multiple affiliate websites. The role involves end-to-end responsibility for website development, SEO optimisation, content strategy, traffic acquisition, and affiliate revenue growth. The successful candidate will be proactive, data-driven, and capable of working independently while delivering measurable results.

YOU MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE with AMAZON AFFILIATE WEBSITES to be considered.

We will not respond if you have no experience.

You will need to work Melbourne, Australian hours. 8.30am - 5.30pm

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Website Setup & Management

o Build, configure, and maintain WordPress (or equivalent CMS) websites for Amazon affiliate programs.

o Ensure fast, secure, and mobile-friendly site performance.

o Implement structured product comparison tables, review layouts, and affiliate link tracking.



• Content Strategy & Creation

o Develop content plans for product reviews, buying guides, and blogs targeting profitable niches.

o Coordinate with writers/designers (in-house or freelance) to ensure SEO-friendly, high-quality content.

o Upload, format, and optimise content for readability and conversion.



• Affiliate Program Management

o Manage Amazon Associates accounts, ensuring compliance with Amazon’s policies.

o Insert, track, and optimise affiliate links and product promotions.

o Monitor affiliate dashboards and report on earnings, trends, and conversion rates.



• SEO & Digital Marketing

o Conduct keyword research and competitor analysis to drive targeted traffic.

o Optimise on-page SEO (titles, meta tags, alt text, schema, internal linking).

o Build backlinks and implement off-page SEO strategies.

o Track site analytics (Google Analytics, Search Console) and adjust strategy.



• Performance & Reporting

o Provide weekly/monthly performance reports (traffic, rankings, conversions, earnings).

o Continuously test strategies to improve CTR and conversion rates.

o Recommend new niches and growth opportunities.

________________________________________



Key Skills & Requirements

• Strong knowledge of Amazon Affiliate / Associates Program.

• Hands-on experience with WordPress, Elementor, WooCommerce (or similar platforms).

• Proficiency in SEO best practices, Google Analytics, Search Console, and keyword tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Ubersuggest, etc.).

• Familiarity with affiliate link management plugins (ThirstyAffiliates, Lasso, etc.).

• Ability to create and implement content marketing strategies.

• Strong research, analytical, and reporting skills.

• Experience with basic graphic editing (Canva/Photoshop) is a plus.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

• Self-motivated, reliable, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

________________________________________

Qualifications

• Minimum 2 years’ experience in affiliate marketing, SEO, or website management.

• Demonstrated success in growing traffic and affiliate revenue.

• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, IT, Business, or related field (preferred, not required).

________________________________________

Reporting Structure

• Reports directly to: Business Owner & Offshore Team Manager

• Works closely with: In house Content writers, designers, SEO consultants (as required).

________________________________________

Remuneration & Benefits

• Competitive salary in PHP (based on experience).

• Performance-based incentives/bonuses linked to revenue growth.

• Salary will be received every 15th or 16th day of each month.

• Holidays: 20 days paid holiday per year accrued.

• Sick Leave: 10 days paid sick leave per year accrued. 

• You will receive a 13th Month bonus paid each December pro-rata of your employment. Note: 13th month bonus is only applicable to staff who are still with the company on month of December. 

• Public Holidays: Australian Public Holidays

• Flexible working hours (output and results driven).

• Long-term career development with opportunities to scale responsibilities as websites grow.

• We require a one (1) month Leave Notice for any plans of Resignation. Anything before that will be deducted from your month’s salary. 

________________________________________

Equipment Must Haves: 

• Own computer or laptop & two screens (monitors).

• Excellent working headphones and video camera.

• Excellent internet connection, and back-up for any internet/power interruption.





Note: For all interested applicants, send a message here with "AMAZON I'm in" in Subject Line.

title: URGENT NEED! Video Editor for AUSTRALIAN COMPANY
description:
Job Description:

Work with a growing Australian online retailer with industry leading brands in fitness equipment, children’s play equipment and bicycles; Gain practical experience editing and finalizing digital videos for a highly diverse range of products.



You will be tasked with editing product promotional videos, instructional and short presentations. You will be working with our visual marketing team, which consists of marketing, graphics and video specialists.



Work with an Australian company that allows you to work during reasonable times. Our timezone is GMT+10.

Certified work from home and pay is on hourly basis.



About us:

As one of Australia’s top Sporting & Leisure companies with 20+ iconic brands, we’re expanding our marketing team. You’ll collaborate with our marketing team to produce videos that will be seen by millions of customers.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

• Editing and assembling recorded raw material into a suitable, finished product ready videos to desired target market.

• Create rough and final cuts

• Input music, dialogues, graphics and effects.

• Adapt final cuts to different platforms and resolutions



SKILLS REQUIRED

• Proven work experience as a Video Editor

• Strong editing skills, with basic knowledge in animation & audio.

• Solid experience with digital technology and editing software packages (e.g. Davinci Resolve, Premiere, After Effects and Final Cut) to edit finalise and deliver desired content.



DESIRED

• Basic animation & sound editing knowledge

• A portfolio showcasing a diverse range of skills and mediums

• Previous experience in similar videos

• Excellent communication skills

• Strong attention to detail

• Highly organised

• Able to work within Australian office hours of 9am – 5pm (GMT +10)



If you think you are the best person for the job above, please send us your CV and sample videos (preferably promotional or product videos).

title: Full Time Cold Calling and Appointment Setting VA (US Clients, CRM Updates, Daily Reporting)
description:
Dominari Solutions is hiring a full time Virtual Assistant focused on outbound calling, follow up, appointment setting, and clean CRM updates for US based clients. This is a phone heavy role. If you do not enjoy talking on the phone, or you are not comfortable handling objections and rejection, please do not apply.



This position follows US business hours, which means you will be working night shift in Philippine time. You must be reliable, consistent, and able to show up on time daily.



Work Schedule



Full time, 40 hours per week.

Night shift in PH time to align with US business hours.

Exact hours will be assigned based on the client’s time zone and campaign.



Pay and Growth



Starting pay is $5.00 per hour, paid weekly.

Pay can increase over time based on reliability, skill, results, and overall performance. Strong performers get priority for raises and better client accounts.



What You Will Do



• Make outbound calls to leads using the client’s dialer or calling system

• Follow scripts and training, then improve delivery over time with coaching

• Handle objections professionally and keep control of the conversation

• Qualify leads and set appointments when the lead is a good fit

• Log call outcomes correctly in the CRM, including notes, tags, dispositions, and follow up tasks

• Complete daily follow ups consistently and on time

• Submit a daily end of shift report in Slack with your numbers and key notes

• Communicate clearly if you have questions, issues, or blockers



What We Track



• Dials completed

• Conversations

• Qualified leads

• Appointments booked

• Follow ups completed

• CRM accuracy and completeness

• Daily report quality and consistency

• Reliability and attendance



Requirements (Read Carefully)



Clear, neutral English is required.

You must be easy to understand for US prospects on the phone.

Please do not apply if you have a heavy accent that makes it difficult for US leads to understand you.



You must be comfortable speaking on the phone for most of your shift.

Please do not apply if you dislike phone work.



You must have the following:

• Strong and stable internet connection

• Quiet workspace with minimal background noise

• Laptop or PC from 2023 or newer

• Noise cancelling headset with a good microphone

• Ability to work night shift PH time consistently



Nice to Have



• Cold calling or appointment setting experience

• Experience with CRMs such as Podio, GoHighLevel, Follow Up Boss, or similar

• Real estate, home services, or sales support experience



Important, Read the Entire Job Description



Applications are reviewed based on attention to detail. If you did not read the full post, you will not be considered.



To apply, complete this application form:





To confirm you read the entire job description, start your message with the word: DOMINARI

If you do not include DOMINARI, your application will be skipped.

title: Virtual Office Manager
description:
Haley’s Cleaning Services Is Hiring a Virtual Office Manager



About Us

Haley’s Cleaning Services is a fast-growing, family-owned luxury residential and commercial cleaning company. We are a system-driven business focused on structure, consistency, and delivering a five-star client experience.

As we scale, we are restructuring our internal operations and are looking for a Virtual Office Manager to take ownership of our back-office systems, payroll, and administrative workflows. This role is ideal for someone who thrives behind the scenes, enjoys organization and accountability, and wants to grow into a leadership position over time.



Position Overview

The Virtual Office Manager is a back-office–focused role responsible for keeping internal systems organized, payroll accurate, and operations running smoothly.

This position involves light customer interaction when needed, and occasional phone coverage as a backup.

You will work closely with ownership and leadership and will play a key role in building structure as the company continues to grow.



Key Responsibilities

Office Administration

-Manage internal
 communication and follow-ups

-Attend and present Key performance indicator at the weekly office meetings

-Track company tasks, deadlines, and recurring admin workflows

-Maintain organized digital files and internal documentation





Payroll & Financial Administration (Full Ownership)

-Manage weekly payroll processes and time tracking

-Prepare and finalize payroll reports

-Upload pay documentation and schedule payments

-Track payroll-related KPIs weekly, monthly, and annually

-Maintain accuracy and confidentiality of all payroll data



Operations Support

-Assist with scheduling support and internal coordination

-Track operational metrics and performance data

-Prepare reports related to availability, scheduling accuracy, and workflow efficiency

-Support leadership with operational reporting and documentation

-Handle customer
s or confirmations when needed

-Occasionally answer phone calls as.





What We’re Looking For

-Strong English Communication Skills (written and spoken)

-Highly Organized & Detail-Oriented – you enjoy structure, checklists, and accuracy

-Reliable & Self-Managed – able to work independently with clear expectations

-Comfortable With Responsibility – especially payroll and confidential information

-Availability – flexible schedule, but able to maintain consistent working hours once established

-Growth-Oriented – interested in growing into a lead role and supporting additional businesses over time





Growth Opportunities

-Strong growth potential for the right person. As our company continues to expand, you may have the opportunity to:

-Grow into a Lead Office Manager or Leadership Role

-Earn performance-based bonuses as responsibilities increase

-Support and work across our family of sister companies as we continue to launch and scale new businesses

-Take on higher-level responsibilities and help build systems from the ground up

-Become a long-term, trusted part of a growing, multi-business organization

-Oversight of additional virtual assistants

-Support across multiple businesses under the same ownership

-Increased responsibility and compensation over time based on performance







Compensation & Schedule

Training Pay: $120–$150 per week





Post-Training Salary: $170 per week (~$600/month)





Hours: 20-30 hours per week





Schedule: Flexible, structured around availability, with consistency required once set





Location: 100% Remote





Training Provided: Yes – all systems, processes, and expectations are fully trained







How to Apply

Please submit:

A short video introducing yourself and why you’re a good fit for a back-office Office Manager role





A brief overview of your administrative, payroll, or virtual assistant experience





Your current availability (days and times)

title: Product Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a highly organised and detail-oriented Production Coordinator to support the Lendelli team and oversee production operations across the business. This role is central to ensuring every custom jewellery piece is delivered with precision, exceptional quality, and on schedule. The position plays a vital role in maintaining consistency, accuracy, and seamless coordination between the sales and production teams. 



About the Role



The Production Coordinator will manage the end-to-end coordination of custom jewellery orders — from quote approval through to final delivery. You will work closely with the sales team, suppliers, CAD designers, setters, manufacturers, and other external stakeholders to translate approved quotes into beautifully executed jewellery pieces.

This role requires strong organisational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.

The position is primarily remote and requires excellent communication, proactive problem-solving, and confident use of digital systems.



What you'll be doing:

* Manage the full lifecycle of jewellery orders from quote approval to final delivery

* Coordinate production schedules with suppliers, including setters, CAD designers, and manufacturers

* Ensure all job details are accurately captured and updated in 

* Monitor the progress of each piece and proactively address delays or production issues

* Confirm specifications such as metal type, diamond details, finger size, and design requirements prior to production

   logistics including shipping, tracking, and quality control checks.

* Upload and review comprehensive supplier quotes

* Calculate recommended retail pricing for the sales team

* Manage job trafficking and order processing within 

* Maintain file organisation using Dropbox

* Assist with brief preparation using basic image editing software when required



What we are looking for:



* Strong experience in production coordination and operations support

* Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail

* Proficient in 
 (essential)

* Comfortable using Slack, Excel, Dropbox, and Microsoft applications

* Strong time management and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

* Ability to work independently in a remote environment



What We Offer:



* Salary: Php 45,000 

* Leave credit available after 6 months

* Day shift role

* Permanent Work From Home Setup

* Flexible working hours, as long as 8 hours are rendered per day

* Observed Australian public holidays (selected holidays)



Kindly, fill-out this form to complete your application:

title: Virtual CFO
description:
We’re seeking an experienced Virtual CFO (Chief Financial Officer) to work alongside our Group CFO and support a diverse portfolio of SME clients. This role is ideal for a finance professional who is both comfortable in the detail—managing accounts and financial processes—and confident in stepping back to drive strategic planning, budgets, and board-level reporting. You will not need to engage with clients directly although if you want this , you can grow into this no problems. 

Key Responsibilities

Oversee and manage day-to-day accounting and bookkeeping functions for multiple client entities (supported by internal and external teams).



Prepare and review monthly management accounts, cash flow reports, and financial statements.



Develop and monitor client budgets, forecasts, and performance metrics.



Provide strategic financial insight and scenario analysis to support business planning and decision-making.



Coordinate with tax accountants and compliance partners to ensure timely filings and regulatory adherence.



Contribute to the improvement of internal financial systems, processes, and reporting templates.



Attend periodic virtual meetings with clients and the Group CFO to present results and discuss strategic recommendations.



Skills & Experience

CPA or CA qualification preferred.



Minimum 8+ years in a senior finance, accounting, or CFO role (preferably with SME or multi-entity experience).



Strong technical accounting skills (Xero knowledge preferred).



Proven track record in budgeting, forecasting, and management reporting.



Excellent communication and client relationship skills, with the ability to simplify complex financial information.



Highly organised, proactive, and comfortable managing priorities across multiple clients.



Experience in M&A, venture capital , business exit planning would be well regarded but is not essential

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Introduction:

We are a fast growing e-commerce business. We have a strong fan base and customer base. We provide top quality products and top tier customer service. As our bookkeeper, your role is a hybrid between bookkeeping and sales



Responsibilities:

Bookkeeper tasks:



Invoicing wholesalers, tracking payments

Updating wholesalers sheet, modified orders sheet

Booking expenses and receipt management

Tracking revenue and COGS by product

Monthly close and reconciliations



Operating tasks:

Cold calls to potential customers

customer service



Requirements:



CPA required. In-depth understanding and experience (1-3 years) with Shopify, QuickBooks, Google Drive, Google Sheet



Excellent English communication. C2 Mastery required. 



The requirement for English is very high for this role, you need to be very fluent in English



You will be on a screenshare with the team for your shift every time. You will be coming to the “office” to work virtually



The shift is from 9pm - 3am local Philippines time. It is required that you are already on this night shift schedule for at least 6 months with a previous employer



The role is currently for 30 hours a week, however, it can quickly turn to full time work depending how capable you are to do different tasks.



How To Apply:



For the subject line of your application, please do the following steps:

Go to our
 page 
 and find our website. Visit the website and find the t-shirt for sale which has a picture of Alex Pagulayan on it. The words written on the t-shirt + the word Bookkeeper will be your ‘subject line’ to write.



Attach your Portfolio



Answer these to questions:

Are you ok with being on a screenshare during your entire shift every time?

How long did you work on this night shift schedule previously? What was the schedule?



Create a one-minute video on why you would like this position, and why you are a good fit. Upload it to Google Drive and provide the link

title: Video Editor needed for regular, ongoing work
description:
THE COMPANY

Avalon Creative Group is a dynamic and innovative company headquartered in the heart of the San Francisco Bay Area and Silicon Valley in California. We specialize in the creation of captivating and immersive content for corporate clients, offering comprehensive content design, production, and creative services. Working with Avalon Creative Group presents an exciting opportunity for individuals seeking to collaborate with renowned brands, while also offering a continuous learning environment that fosters personal and professional growth.



JOB DESCRIPTION

Avalon Creative Group is seeking a talented and experienced video editor and 3D animator based in the Philippines to work with us as an independent contractor. Our work includes videos to inspire audiences at corporate events, on-demand marketing webinars, internal corporate training and sales enablement, product demos, highlight reels, social media ads, interviews, customer testimonials and more. 



Our goal is to establish a long term working relationship with a creative, reliable and ambitious video professional. After successfully completing an initial trial period, the right person will become an integral member of our creative team on a full-time contract basis.



RESPONSIBILITIES

> Edit high quality videos from a variety of sources, including single-camera, multi-camera, stock footage, AI generated video, graphic elements, music, sound effects, etc.

> Effectively and efficiently generate video footage and elements using the latest AI tools

> Manage accuracy and correction of color and audio

> Understand and apply corporate branding and style guidelines and templates (MOGRTs)

> Manage, organize and backup video assets and deliverables, including raw footage, graphics, sound files, stock footage, projects, files, etc.

> Adhere to budgeted time constraints while incorporating client feedback and changes through multiple rounds of review and revisions

> Contribute to and consistently apply efficient workflow processes and standards (SOPs)

> Document guidelines and process details for tea
mbers and clients

> Pursue ongoing professional development and skill enhancements



REQUIRED SKILLS

> Having a proven track record of punctuality, reliability and professionalism is essential

> Excellent attention to detail and adeptness at managing multiple concurrent projects is required

> Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment

> English fluency (written and spoken) along with excellent communication skills are essential

> You must be based in the Philippines with fast, reliable internet access and a robust computer

> You must have a quiet workspace where you can work without distractions and join Zoom calls



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

> At least 2 years of professional experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Premiere Pro and After Effects

> Bonus if you have experience or proficiency with using 3D software like Blender, Cinema4D, or anything similar.

> You must have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work that demonstrates your passion and experience with video editing and motion graphics

>> Your portfolio must include examples of the type of work listed in the job description section

> Expertise in video editing fundamentals and techniques, including pacing, storytelling, and continuity

> Knowledge of different video formats and codecs for various delivery platforms



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

> 5 years of experience with Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects.

> At least 2 years of experience and proficiency with Blender or Cinema 4D.

> Proficiency in color correction, audio editing, and mastering

> Familiarity with team communication and project management tools like Smartsheet, Slack, ClickUp, or similar platforms

> Familiarity or experience using AI post-production tools

> Strong understanding of visual composition, typography, and graphic design principles

> Completion of training and/or certifications in key software used

> Knowledge of social media platforms and video encoding specifications for each platform



COMPENSATION & ENGAGEMENT

> Compensation rate for full-time, independent contractor will be $
USD per month

> Ten paid holidays and ten days of accrued paid time off (PTO) will be included annually

> Rate will be based on qualifications and experience

> This is a remote work position

> Work hours will need to overlap with standard business hours in California (9:00-6:00pm PT)



HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in working with us as an independent contractor and you meet the required qualifications listed above, please APPLY HERE - 
/
/f/8cfra9g-19833/RD6JGYJONEOXD2WUN0

title: Shortform YouTube Video Editor
description:
Hi there,



We’re looking for a skilled video editor to join our team and create content for our growing network of YouTube channels.



The editing process is straightforward, and we’ll train you on our full workflow. Your main focus will be editing videos based on scripts and voiceovers we provide. You will also be welcome to find footage for these videos.



We offer a monthly salary, and you will be producing around ~30 shortform (15 to 30ish second) videos per month.



To apply, send your portfolio and the word "mango" we will ask for a sample.



Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Development Representative (Remote) UK and US
description:
We’re hiring Business Development Representative (Remote) to lead outbound sales efforts and help businesses adopt industry-leading Microsoft software solutions. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love connecting with decision-makers, and excel at driving revenue—this role is for you.

title: Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert
description:
We are seeking an experienced Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert to manage, secure, and optimise our Google Workspace environment. This role requires a detail-oriented, proactive professional who can assess risks, implement security policies, and protect our organisation from credential leaks, malware threats, and unauthorised access.



You will own the security and administration lifecycle—monitoring accounts, enforcing password and MFA policies, responding to security i
, coordinating with teams on risk mitigation, and ensuring smooth communication regarding security practices. The ideal candidate will also provide guidance to tea
mbers, foster security awareness, and continuously look for ways to improve processes to safeguard both company and client data.





Who We Are:

121 Group is a full-service digital marketing agency that has successfully delivered campaigns for clients across a broad range of industries. We can provide branding, marketing, digital and communication services, specialising in healthcare, fashion, lifestyle & beauty, mining, construction, and renewables. Our data-driven approach to customer acquisition will grow your revenue and allow you to reach new audiences.





Job Summary: 

The Google Workspace Security & Administration Expert is responsible for ensuring the security, management, and compliance of all Google Workspace accounts. Responsibilities include monitoring account activity, enforcing password policies, managing multi-factor authentication, mitigating security risks, coordinating i
 response, and ensuring all tea
mbers follow best practices for digital security. You will work closely with leadership and IT to safeguard sensitive company and client information, guide the team in secure workflows, and proactively identify improvements in system security.





Responsibilities:

- Manage and administer Google Workspace accounts, groups, permissions, and shared resources.

- Enforce enterprise-level password policies, including forced resets and complexity standards.

- Implement and monitor Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all accounts.

- Monitor and respond to credential leaks, unauthorised logins, and suspicious activity.

- Conduct monthly security audits and stress-tests to identify vulnerabilities.

- Investigate malware and security threats on local devices and workstations.

- Guide staff in secure password management and transition to enterprise-grade password managers.

- Coordinate with leadership and IT teams to manage security i
 and ensure business continuity.

- Maintain logs, reports, and documentation of security protocols, i
, and resolutions.

- Proactively identify opportunities to improve system security and internal processes.

- Provide coaching and guidance to tea
mbers on cybersecurity best practices.





Requirements:

- Proven experience managing and securing Google Workspace environments.

- Strong knowledge of enterprise password policies, MFA, and credential management.

- Hands-on experience responding to security i
, malware detection, and credential leaks.

- Familiarity with cybersecurity tools, threat detection, and vulnerability management.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills for guiding staff and reporting to leadership.

- Exceptional organisational, problem-solving, and multitasking skills.

- Ability to manage multiple security priorities simultaneously and meet deadlines.

- Experience documenting processes, SOPs, and i
 reports.

- Flexible and proactive, willing to step in to resolve urgent security issues.

- High integrity and discretion in handling sensitive information.

- Capability to start immediately.

- Certifications are a plus: Google Workspace Administrator, Google Security Engineer, CompTIA Security+, CISSP, or other relevant IT security certifications.



Please send your updated resume and portfolio to

title: UGC/Affiliates Manager - Beauty Brand
description:
Dear Applicant,



For our fast-growing beauty brand, currently scaling rapidly and projected to reach 8 figures in revenue this year, we are looking for a proactive, organized, and relationship-driven UGC Manager / Head of Affiliates to manage all creator partnerships and affiliate collaborations.



To confirm that you have read this message carefully, please start your reply with the word “blueberry” before introducing yourself.



Responsibilities:

- Conducting outreach to new UGC creators across the USA and Germany

- Managing communication with existing UGC creators and maintaining strong relationships

- Coordinating creators for: B-roll clip production, Full UGC videos, Ad-specific content

- Managing and expanding our affiliate network

- Tracking affiliate performance and payouts with Goaffpro

- Affiliate communication

- Ensuring creators deliver on time and according to brand guidelines

- Organizing content briefs, scripts, and creative instructions

- Following up consistently to keep production timelines on track

- Maintaining our creator database and keeping all status updates organized

- Assisting with content reviews, approvals, and quality control

- Serving as the main point of contact between creators and internal teams



Requirements (MUST):

- Proven experience managing UGC creators or influencer partnerships

- Strong communication skills (clear, consistent, professional)

- Highly organized with excellent follow-up and coordination abilities

- Comfortable working with international creators across different time zones

- Experience managing affiliate programs or ambassador programs

- Able to evaluate creator quality and identify strong talent

- Fast responder, proactive communicator, and problem solver

- Independent working style with high ownership

- Available 5–6 days per week

- Experience with Slack or similar communication tools is a plus



Bonus (Nice to Have):

- Experience in beauty, skincare, makeup, or wellness

- Understanding of paid ads and UGC performance metrics

- Experience building creator funnels or ambassador pipelines

- Ability to prepare scripts or briefs for creators

- Familiarity with UGC platforms or affiliate software



Application Requirements:

Please include the following in your application:



- Your CV

- Your LinkedIn profile

- Your experience working with UGC creators and/or affiliates

- Examples of creators or accounts you have managed (if available)

- Do you have experience coordinating UGC content like b-roll clips or full UGC videos?

- Have you managed affiliate programs before?

- Are you comfortable communicating daily with creators and affiliates?

- Are you available 5–6 days per week?



Please send a short voice message to 
explaining your motivation for this role.



If you do not meet all requirements, please do not apply.



We look forward to your response!

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
At fatsecret, our success is entrenched in empowering people to make healthy food and nutrition habits for life. We’re growing and are looking for people who would like to join a supportive team that cares about making a real difference to our clients' lives.

- Time management skills

- Strong work ethic

9am - 5pm AEST

title: URGENT HIRING: Virtual Assistant - Administrator, IT and Accounting Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting
description:
You only get one chance: carefully follow these instructions before applying or you will not hear from us. To apply you must visit our webpage 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/



Company: Health and Life



Location: Remote (with own internet and office facilities)



Job Type: Contract (may go long term depending on performance)



About Us:

Health and Life Access is a well-established healthcare consulting Chartered Accounting firm organisation specialising in the management of service entities and organizations throughout Australia and overseas. We are committed to creating a sustainable and socially responsible healthcare system.



Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Virtual Assistant to provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to our organisation and clients. The successful candidate will report to the CEO and relevant supervisors, ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our business.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to the CEO and other consultants/managers.

Maintain accurate records, perform bookkeeping, and handle client billing.

Assist with financial reporting, budgeting, and petty cash management.

Manage calendars, appointments, and correspondence.

Develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, clients, and suppliers.

Identify and resolve problems promptly, providing potential solutions.

Participate in special projects and additional duties as required.



Requirements:

Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting experience preferred.

Proven experience in administration, IT, and accounting.

Proficiency in using Google Suite, Xero, FileMaker Pro, and other software as specified.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and adhering to ethical standards.

Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently.



Working Conditions:

Standard 38-hour week, Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm ACDT.

Flexible working hours may be required.

Must have own internet and office facilities.

No leave entitlement applies

All tasks are allocated by a Google calendar. The more you complete competently and within budget, the more work you generate.



Fees:

Task-based monthly fees up to $3,000 AUD or equivalent overseas currency. Long term contract positions available based on performance.



Fees reviewed based on performance; potential for multiple fee increases for good performance.



How to Apply:

If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for healthcare administration.



To apply visit our ”Undergraduate up to senior accountant jobs” web page 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/.



Attention to detail matters, so read the application process carefully. You only get one chance.

title: Finance & Accounts Support (Part-Time | Remote | NDIS Experience Favourable)
description:
We’re seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Finance & Accounts Support professional to step into an established role supporting multiple businesses, including an NDIS provider and property investments.



This is an execution-focused role, ideal for someone confident with systems, accuracy, and following clear processes.



Key Responsibilities:

- Process timesheets and prepare Australian payroll in Xero (for approval)

- Maintain accurate financial records and reconciliations

- Manage and update Budgetly for budget tracking and utilisation oversight

- Prepare financial reports for management

- Maintain property financial records in TaxTime, ensuring everything is accountant-ready

- Support financial readiness across businesses (no tax or strategy work)



Role Details:

- Start: ASAP

- Hours: 15 per week to start

- Location: Remote

- Clear systems and workflows already in place



Requirements:

- Strong experience with Xero

- Experience with Australian payroll

- NDIS experience highly favourable

- High attention to detail and accuracy

- Ability to work independently and follow established processes

- Experience with Budgetly and/or TaxTime highly regarded

- Professional communication and reliability are essential



To Apply:

Submit your application via this link: https://forms.clickup.com/90161076863/f/2kz09pkz-6976/CA444FLDLRRQNPHLUV

title: Australian Paraplanner VA
description:
Paraplanner Virtual Assistant (Remote – Supporting Australian Financial Adviser)



About the Role



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Paraplanner Virtual Assistant to support our Australian Financial Adviser/Financial Planning Firm. This role is ideal for someone with strong experience in Australian financial services administration, compliance documentation, and paraplanning support.



You will play a key role in preparing advice documents, managing compliance requirements, and ensuring smooth client service delivery.



Key Responsibilities



???? Paraplanning Support



Prepare and draft Statements of Advice (SOA)



Prepare Records of Advice (ROA)



Assist with strategy modelling and research



Prepare client projections and cash flow modelling



Product comparisons and research (superannuation, insurance, investments)

Ensure advice documents meet ASIC compliance standards



Maintain accurate client files and records



Assist with fact-finding documentation



Prepare implementation paperwork

Required Experience & Skills:



Experience supporting an Australian financial planning firm

- Familiarity with ASIC compliance requirements



- Experience using financial planning software (e.g., Xplan, AdviserLogic, Midwinter, or similar)

RG146 certification (preferred but not required)



Background in finance, accounting, or financial planning



Experience with Australian compliance frameworks



Knowledge of Australian tax and superannuation environment

title: Roadside Assistance Inbound Sales & Dispatch Specialist
description:
(Growth Pathway to Sales Manager / Team Leader)



Company: Staff Connect (on behalf of our client)

Location: Remote – Philippines-based

Schedule: Rotating shifts between 5:00 PM – 9:00 AM AEDT

Employment Type: Full-time

Compensation: Competitive salary (based on experience and qualifications)

Leave: One week paid leave per year



About the Client



Our client is Australia’s largest misfuelling specialist, providing nationwide roadside assistance to motorists who a
 put the wrong fuel in their vehicle. When drivers are stressed and stranded, their team steps in to turn the situation around — quickly, professionally, and with empathy.



Staff Connect is supporting the client in building their first offshore team in the Philippines, offering a genuine opportunity for high performers to grow into leadership roles and eventually manage an entire offshore operation.



The Role

Inbound Sales & Dispatcher



Growth Pathway: Sales Manager / Team Leader



You will start in a frontline Inbound Sales & Dispatch role, handling incoming calls, assisting distressed customers, and coordinating technicians across Australia.



As you demonstrate strong sales ability, attention to detail, and initiative, you’ll progressively take on operations, quality control, and leadership responsibilities, with a clear pathway to advance into a Sales Manager / Team Leader position.



Key Responsibilities

Core Dispatch & Inbound Sales

- Act as the first point of contact for motorists who have misfuelled their vehicle.

- Use empathy and strong communication skills to convert inbound calls into confirmed bookings.

- Coordinate technicians nationwide using booking platforms and real-time tools.

- Collect deposits, log jobs accurately, and manage cases from start to completion.

- Communicate with customers and technicians via phone, Gmail, Slack, and SMS



Daily Operations & Quality Control

- Support fleet job closures, including managing long wait times when calling for PO numbers.

- Track spill kit usage by collecting all related
s and invoices in Xero (create only, do not send).

- Maintain accuracy in Xero and GeoOp, including:

- Reviewing previous day’s jobs for incomplete entries.

- Identifying jobs not properly closed or not sent to Xero.

- Perform call log clean-ups, ensuring:

- Objection reasons are correctly logged.

- ETAs, phone times, and job numbers are accurate.

- Sales opportunities are identified and closed.

- Discounts are properly logged and ticked.

- Act as a second set of eyes on GeoOp and call logs to catch errors, fill gaps, and prevent missed opportunities.



Documentation & Process Support

- Update fleet documents using new templates for consistency and clarity.

- Assist with process mapping, staff training, and continuous improvement initiatives.



Tech & Customer Support

- Coordinate servo runs and tech card runs to keep dispatch lines clear.

- Take ownership of escalated customer issues requiring extended phone support.

- Be comfortable being on camera during Slack huddles as part of daily operations.

- Participate in Slack huddles during shifts, including training, check-ins, and live support.



The Successful Candidate

- Minimum 2 years’ experience in a call centre, sales, or dispatch role.

- Proven success in sales conversion and customer service.

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Calm under pressure, with strong empathy for customers in stressful situations.

- Tech-savvy, with proficiency in Google Chrome, Gmail, and Google Workspace.

- Comfortable using Slack, including joining huddles and appearing on camera when required.

- Experience working from home with reliable internet and a quiet workspace.

- Bonus: Experience in automotive, roadside assistance, or mobile repair.

- Bonus: Knowledge of Australian geography.



What’s in It for You

- Fully remote, work-from-home role.

- Work with a growing international client.

- Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

- Clear career progression: Dispatcher ? Sales Manager / Team Leader.

- Supportive, professional team culture.

- Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

title: Paid Ads UGC Video Editor
description:
Join Blackboard Agency – Video Editor Wanted



At Blackboard, we create scroll-stopping, high-performing ads for some of the fastest-growing DTC and ecommerce brands. Our work blends data-driven strategy with stand-out creative, and now we’re looking for a Video Editor who knows how to turn raw creator footage into ads that actually convert.



Your Role



Edit UGC-style ads that stop the scroll and drive ROAS.



Add engaging text overlays, captions, and transitions that feel native to TikTok, IG Reels, and Meta Ads.



Optimise videos for platform-specific formats and placements.



Elevate pacing, music, and hooks to maximise conversions.



Collaborate with our creative strategists to test and iterate on performance-backed edits.



Who You Are



You’ve edited UGC ads for DTC/ecommerce brands before.



You understand social ad psychology – what makes someone stop, watch, and buy.



Skilled with Premiere Pro, After Effects, or similar tools.



Can edit fast without sacrificing quality.



Obsessed with the details that turn an ad from “just content” into a top performer.



Perks



Full-time remote role (40 hrs/week).



Competitive salary + performance bonuses.



Work on exciting global wellness, beauty, and lifestyle brands.



Be part of a fast-moving, results-driven agency with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



Send your portfolio & past UGC ad edits.



Use the subject line: “UGC Editor – Blackboard”. (Only these applications will be reviewed)



In 2–3 sentences, tell us why you’re the perfect fit.



Only send your best UGC work.



Apply now and help us create ads that don’t just look good – they perform.

title: Senior Customer Service Representative (Part-Time, Remote - E-commerce)
description:
Company: US-based E-commerce Brand?Hours: Part-Time (20–25 hours/week + )?Schedule: Must overlap with US business hours?Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)



Who This Role Is For

This role is for experienced e-commerce customer support professionals who have already worked inside Zendesk and directly managed fulfillment issues with a 3PL.

If you are new to customer service, still learning Zendesk, or have only handled chat/email without order systems, this role is not a fit.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

You will own customer support tickets end-to-end, not just reply to messages.

* Managing inbound support tickets in Zendesk

* Investigating shipping issues and providing accurate, timely resolutions

* Creating replacement orders directly in ShipBob

* Locating, verifying, and sending tracking numbers

* Resolving:

    * Lost or delayed shipments

    * Damaged or missing items

    * Fulfillment errors

* Communicating clearly and confidently with US-based customers

* Following SOPs while exercising judgment on edge cases

* Flagging trends or repeat issues to management



Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Applicants must meet all of the following:

? Zendesk experience (minimum 1+ year)?? E-commerce customer support experience?? Experience working with a 3PL (ShipBob strongly preferred)?? Excellent written English (clear, professional, and customer-friendly)?? Comfortable handling order systems, tracking tools, and dashboards?? Able to work independently with minimal supervision

? Ability to handle 200+ tickets in 3/4 hour shift efficiently without sacrificing quality

Applications that do not meet these requirements will not be considered.



Strong Advantages

* Direct ShipBob dashboard experience

* Shopify order management experience

* Prior support for US or EU brands

* Experience in SOP-driven, KPI-tracked environments





Tools You’ll Use

* Zendesk – primary ticketing system

* ShipBob – fulfillment, replacements, tracking

* Shopify – order reference

* iMessage / Google voice for team communication 



Compensation & Growth

* Competitive hourly rate based on experience

* Consistent weekly hours

* Opportunities for bonus if KPIs are met

* Opportunity to grow into expanded hours or senior ownership if performance is strong

title: Amazon Keepa Expert / Product Research VA (Keepa + Seller Central)
description:
Overview



We’re looking for a Keepa expert who can analyze Amazon products using Keepa charts + key metrics and provide profitable, low-risk leads. You must be confident reading price history, sales rank behavior, and identifying risks like IP complaints, restricted brands, and listing issues.



Key Responsibilities



Analyze products using Keepa (price history, rank history, offer count, buy box trends).



Confirm profitability using required inputs (cost, fees, shipping, prep, taxes when needed).



Identify risk factors:



IP/brand enforcement signals (aggressive brands, frequent takedowns).



Hazmat, meltable, restrictions/gating, brand approval needs.



Variation issues, bundle/multipack confusion, listing changes.



Check competition:



Offer count trends, Amazon in/out of stock patterns, buy box share behavior.



FBA vs FBM seller mix and fee impacts.



Deliver daily/weekly lead sheets with clear notes and screenshots:



ASIN, title, ROI %, profit $, sales rank, estimated sales, offer count, risk notes.



Follow sourcing rules (no restricted categories/brands as instructed).



Communicate clearly, respond quickly, and meet daily targets.



Required Skills



Strong ability to interpret Keepa charts, including:



Sales Rank drops and consistency



Buy Box history



New/Used price trends



Offer count changes



Amazon in-stock/out-of-stock patterns



Familiar with Amazon Seller Central basics (fees, restrictions, prep, FBA/FBM).



Comfortable using spreadsheets (Google Sheets/Excel).



High attention to detail and strong written English.



Preferred Tools (Nice to Have)



SellerAmp / RevSeller / Sellerboard / Jungle Scout (optional)



Tactical Arbitrage / Source Mogul (optional)



Basic understanding of Amazon policy risks (IP, authenticity, restricted brands)



Deliverables / Expectations



Provide X profitable leads per day (example: 5–10) that meet minimum criteria:



Minimum ROI: ___%



Minimum profit per unit: $___



Max sellers / max offer count: ___ (if required)



Must include Keepa screenshot + notes



Organized tracking sheet updated daily



Consistent communication and accuracy (low error rate)



Candidates must complete a short test:



Analyze 5 ASINs using Keepa



Provide: ROI/profit estimate, chart interpretation, risk notes, and final decision (buy/skip)



Pay



Hourly: $__4_/hr or



Per lead: $__1_ per qualified lead (valid, profitable, low-risk)



If you are this person please apply if not don't waste my timer and yours

title: Paid Search Strategist (Google Ads Certified)
description:
Paid Search Strategist



Salary: $3,200 USD per month

Schedule: Full time, U.S. PST hours

Location: Remote



Role Overview:



We are hiring a Paid Search Strategist to manage high volume paid search and YouTube campaigns for a U.S. marketing agency. This role owns campaign execution from setup through optimization, budget management, reporting, and delivering actionable insights aligned to client KPIs.



This is a client facing role that requires strong English communication, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently across multiple accounts.



Responsibilities:



- Manage high volume paid search and YouTube campaigns for multiple clients

- Set up, manage, and optimize paid search campaigns

- Maintain campaign budgets and pacing against defined CPA and CPC goals

- Identify campaign risks and optimization opportunities

- Engage in initial planning and ongoing optimization of SEM campaigns

- Develop and deliver reporting with actionable insights

- Build strong internal and external relationships

= Participate in client discussions related to performance and results

- Ensure campaigns align with client goals and expectations



Required Qualifications:



- Google Ads Certifications

- Three plus years experience managing high volume paid search campaigns

- Experience managing CPA and CPC driven campaigns

- Experience with Google Ads and YouTube campaigns

- Client facing experience with strong verbal and written English

- Ability to extract actionable insights from analytics tools

- Self starter with the ability to work independently

- Bachelor’s degree in a related field



Success Indicators:



- Campaigns meet or improve CPA and CPC targets

- Budgets are paced accurately with no surprises

- Clear, actionable insights are delivered through reporting

- Clients understand performance and trust recommendations

- Minimal oversight required after ramp up



Work Requirements:



- Professional, client ready English communication skills

- Ability to manage multiple accounts and deadlines

- Reliable internet connection and professional home setup



Benefits:



- Paid vacation, holiday, and sick leave after probation

- Bi-monthly payroll via Wise

- Dedicated Workspark support and onboarding

- Long term, stable role with a U.S. based team



Application Instructions:



Apply using this link: 

- Include a short voice or video recording introducing yourself

- Explain your experience managing paid search campaigns and working with clients

**Applications without a voice or video introduction will not be reviewed**
