title: Full Time Cold Calling and Appointment Setting VA (US Clients, CRM Updates, Daily Reporting)
description:
Dominari Solutions is hiring a full time Virtual Assistant focused on outbound calling, follow up, appointment setting, and clean CRM updates for US based clients. This is a phone heavy role. If you do not enjoy talking on the phone, or you are not comfortable handling objections and rejection, please do not apply.



This position follows US business hours, which means you will be working night shift in Philippine time. You must be reliable, consistent, and able to show up on time daily.



Work Schedule



Full time, 40 hours per week.

Night shift in PH time to align with US business hours.

Exact hours will be assigned based on the client’s time zone and campaign.



Pay and Growth



Starting pay is $5.00 per hour, paid weekly.

Pay can increase over time based on reliability, skill, results, and overall performance. Strong performers get priority for raises and better client accounts.



What You Will Do



• Make outbound calls to leads using the client’s dialer or calling system

• Follow scripts and training, then improve delivery over time with coaching

• Handle objections professionally and keep control of the conversation

• Qualify leads and set appointments when the lead is a good fit

• Log call outcomes correctly in the CRM, including notes, tags, dispositions, and follow up tasks

• Complete daily follow ups consistently and on time

• Submit a daily end of shift report in Slack with your numbers and key notes

• Communicate clearly if you have questions, issues, or blockers



What We Track



• Dials completed

• Conversations

• Qualified leads

• Appointments booked

• Follow ups completed

• CRM accuracy and completeness

• Daily report quality and consistency

• Reliability and attendance



Requirements (Read Carefully)



Clear, neutral English is required.

You must be easy to understand for US prospects on the phone.

Please do not apply if you have a heavy accent that makes it difficult for US leads to understand you.



You must be comfortable speaking on the phone for most of your shift.

Please do not apply if you dislike phone work.



You must have the following:

• Strong and stable internet connection

• Quiet workspace with minimal background noise

• Laptop or PC from 2023 or newer

• Noise cancelling headset with a good microphone

• Ability to work night shift PH time consistently



Nice to Have



• Cold calling or appointment setting experience

• Experience with CRMs such as Podio, GoHighLevel, Follow Up Boss, or similar

• Real estate, home services, or sales support experience



Important, Read the Entire Job Description



Applications are reviewed based on attention to detail. If you did not read the full post, you will not be considered.



To apply, complete this application form:





To confirm you read the entire job description, start your message with the word: DOMINARI

If you do not include DOMINARI, your application will be skipped.

title: Lead Generation Data Engineer
description:
The Opportunity



We’re looking for someone who sits at the intersection of data engineering and B2B lead generation. Not a pure data scientist who wants to build models in Jupyter notebooks all day, and not a pure SDR who manually scrolls LinkedIn. We need the person in the middle — someone who can build automated enrichment pipelines that turn raw prospect lists into scored, personalized, outreach-ready leads at scale.



Think of it this way: our BDRs currently spend 60% of their time researching and qualifying leads. Your job is to flip that ratio so they spend 90% of their time actually talking to prospects.



What You’ll Own

1. Enrichment Pipeline Architecture (
)

Build and maintain automated Clay tables that take raw prospect lists and enrich them through chained data sources:

• LinkedIn Sales Navigator exports ? Clay ingestion

• 
 + phone enrichment with waterfall fallback 

•
 deliverability verification 

• Decision-maker title and seniority confirmation

• Company size, employee count, and location count

• Website scraping for retail product pages — detect whether the clinic sells skincare products online, which brands they carry (SkinCeuticals, ZO Skin Health, Environ, etc.), and whether they have a house/private label line

• LinkedIn activity recency (active profiles = higher outreach response rates)

• Growth signals from job postings and new location announcements

You own the entire pipeline from raw list to CRM-ready enriched record.



2. ICP Scoring Model

Design and iterate on a lead scoring system based on our Ideal Customer Profile:

• Clinic type weighting (medical spa > dermatology > plastic surgery > day spa)

• Decision-maker seniority (Owner/Founder > Medical Director > VP Ops > Practice Manager)

• Company size and growth signals (new locations, recent hiring, job postings)

• Retail product signals — clinics with an online shop or product page score higher than those without

• Private label indicators — clinics already selling a house-brand line signal existing manufacturer relationships

• Geographic market priority (US Tier 1 states > secondary markets > international)

• LinkedIn activity and engagement recency

Output: every lead gets a 0–100 score and a Tier 1 / Tier 2 / Disqualify tag before any human touches it.



3. CRM Data Operations (HubSpot)

Ensure enriched, scored leads flow cleanly into our HubSpot CRM with all custom properties populated:

• Clay ? HubSpot sync (automated push of enriched records)

• Contact deduplication and data hygiene

• Custom property population (we have 161 custom properties across Companies, Contacts, and Deals)

• Filtered views by contact type, lead score, geography, and engagement stage

• Weekly data quality audits 
 bounce rates, missing fields, stale records)



4. Outreach Personalization Data

Feed our BDRs the personalization hooks they need to write messages that convert:

• Current product brands the clinic carries (scraped from website shop/retail pages)

• Whether they sell a private label or house-brand skincare line (signals existing manufacturer relationship)

• Recent LinkedIn posts or articles by the prospect

• Growth signals (new location openings, recent hiring, job postings)

• Review sentiment indicators — Google/Yelp mentions of products, skincare results, or retail experience

• Any mentions of international sourcing, K-beauty, or clean beauty on their website or social



5. Feedback Loop & Optimization

Close the loop between enrichment quality and actual conversion:

• Track which scored leads convert to discovery calls vs. which don’t

• Refine scoring weights based on real pipeline data

• A/B test different enrichment sources for accuracy and cost-effectiveness

• Monthly report: conversion rates by score tier, data accuracy metrics, pipeline contribution



Who You Are

Skills

• Proficiency with 
 (table building, waterfall enrichment, API integrations)

• Experience with 
, 
, or similar
/contact enrichment tools

• LinkedIn Sales Navigator fluency (boolean searches, saved searches, list exports)

• HubSpot CRM experience (contact/company/deal management, custom properties, views)

• Basic scripting ability (Python, JavaScript, or n8n/Zapier for automation glue)

• Understanding of B2B lead generation workflows and sales development processes

• Strong English communication (written reports, async Slack updates)



Nice-to-Have Skills

• Experience in healthcare, aesthetics, medical devices, or cosmetics B2B

• Familiarity with n8n or 
 for workflow automation

• SQL or spreadsheet-level data analysis (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, data cleaning)

• Experience building lead scoring models (even simple weighted models)

• Knowledge of
 deliverability best practices (SPF, DKIM, warm-up)

• Web scraping experience (extracting product/brand data from clinic websites)

Mindset

• Builder mentality — you’d rather automate a 2-hour task than do it manually twice

• Comfortable with ambiguity — we’re pre-revenue and figuring things out

• Data-driven but practical — a good-enough model shipped today beats a perfect model next month

• Ownership orientation — you flag problems AND propose solutions



Tech Stack




 Enrichment pipeline, waterfall logic, lead scoring Provided


/phone finding, contact database Provided

LinkedIn Sales Nav Prospect identification, boolean search Provided

HubSpot CRM Pipeline management, 161 custom properties Provided

ZeroBounce / AbstractAPI
 verification Provided

Google Sheets Supplemental analysis, reporting Provided

Slack Team communication, async updates Provided

Loom Async walkthroughs and demos Provided

n8n (optional) Workflow automation if needed Available



What a Sample Week Looks Like

Monday — Pipeline Build & Refresh (4 hrs)

• Pull new Sales Navigator searches for target geographies

• Ingest into Clay tables, kick off enrichment chains

• QA overnight enrichment results from prior batch

Tuesday — Scoring & CRM Push (3 hrs)

• Run scoring model on enriched batch

• Push Tier 1 and Tier 2 leads to HubSpot with all fields populated

• Flag any data quality issues (high bounce risk
s, missing fields)

Wednesday — Personalization Layer (4 hrs)

• Enrich Tier 1 leads with personalization hooks (product brands carried, private label status, recent posts)

• Build personalization notes for BDR outreach templates

• Coordinate with BDRs on priority accounts

Thursday — Optimization & Analysis (3 hrs)

• Pull conversion data: which leads from last 2 weeks got meetings?

• Analyze patterns: what scoring factors predicted conversion?

• Adjust weights, test new enrichment sources

Friday — Reporting & Planning (3 hrs)

• Weekly report: leads enriched, scoring distribution, data quality metrics

• Pipeline contribution summary for team standup

• Plan next week’s target geographies and enrichment experiments



Key Performance Indicators



Enriched leads delivered per week 

 accuracy rate 

Enrichment completeness

Tier 1 leads per week 

CRM data freshness 

Scoring model accuracy 

Weekly report delivery 



Growth Path

This role has a clear trajectory as MultiOrigin Partners scales:

• Phase 1 (Now): 15–25 hrs/week. Build the enrichment pipeline, prove the scoring model, establish CRM data operations.

• Phase 2 (Month 3–6): 25–35 hrs/week. Scale to multiple geographies, add supplier-side enrichment, build dashboards and analytics layer.

• Phase 3 (Month 6+): Full-time potential. Own all data operations, manage data team, architect migration to curated B2B marketplace platform.





How to Apply

Send a brief message (not a generic cover letter) addressing:

1. Your experience with 
 (or similar enrichment platforms). Specific examples preferred.

2. A time you automated or scaled a lead generation process. What was the before/after?

3. Your hourly rate and weekly availability.

4. One thing you’d want to know about our ICP before building the enrichment pipeline.



Paid Test Task 



Top candidates will be given a paid test task:

“Given a list of 30 medical spa companies in California (we provide the list), build a Clay table that enriches each with: verified decision-maker
, company size, services offered, whether they have a retail product page on their website, and a lead score (0–100) based on criteria we provide. Push results to a Google Sheet with your scoring rationale.”

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
3 hours per day | Australian company | Independent contractor | AEST overlap required 



StackUp is an Australian technology company helping leaders benchmark and improve their technology function. 

We work with senior executives globally. Communication quality matters. 

We’re hiring a sharp, proactive Administrative Assistant to support the Founder directly. 

This is not a basic VA role. 

You’ll help manage high-level communication with CTOs, CEOs and technology leaders. 

If you’re organised, commercially aware, and confident working with senior professionals - keep reading. 







The Role 

You will work approximately 3 hours per day, overlapping with Australian Eastern Time. 



1. LinkedIn & Sales Support 

- Draft LinkedIn replies/messages (in the Founder’s voice) 

- Manage connection requests 

- Book appointments using Calendly 

- Support light sales follow-up & keep conversations moving 

2. Inbox Management 

- Filter spam and low-value
s 

- Prioritise important messages & draft concise, high quality replies for approval 

- Maintain inbox organisation and responsiveness 

3. LinkedIn Content Support 

- Turn supplied ideas into sharp, engaging LinkedIn posts 

- Maintain the Founder’s direct, clear tone 

- Suggest improvements where appropriate 

- Format and schedule posts when required 





Tools We Use 



Experience preferred (but not mandatory): 

- HubSpot 

- LinkedIn Sales Navigator 

- Calendly 

- Microsoft Teams 

- ChatGPT or similar AI tools 

You must be comfortable learning new tools quickly. 



Who You Are 

- Excellent written English (professional level) 

- Experience supporting executives or founders & drafting communication for senior leaders 

- Strong organisational skills & commercially aware commercially aware (you understand business conversations) 

- Confident giving thoughtful feedback 



Bonus (not required): 

- B2B sales support experience 

- SaaS or tech industry exposure 

- Experience supporting Australian clients 





The Opportunity 

- Direct exposure to a growing Australian tech company 

- Work closely with a Founder 

- Real responsibility, not repetitive admin tasks 

- Potential to grow into GTM support or operations as the company scales 





Engagement Details 

- Independent contractor 

- Paid monthly 

- Long-term opportunity for the right person 

- Mid-level executive assistant compensation $500 PHP per hour





Application Instructions 

To be considered, include: 

- A short introduction about yourself 

- A brief summary of your executive support experience 

- Your expected hourly rate (in AUD) 

- A short LinkedIn-style post (150–200 words) on: 

- “Why inconsistent communication costs growing companies opportunities.” 

Applications without the requested items will not be reviewed. 



 

If you're serious about building a long-term remote career supporting senior leadership - this role is for you.

title: Social Media Editor & Content Manager (High-Impact Reels) – Fitness Brand

PART- TIME AT FIRST THEN FULL-TIME HIRE - GROWING FITNESS BRAND

title: E Commerce Growth Lead, Build Our Digital Revenue Engine, Amazon First, Launch New Channels
description:
E-Commerce Growth Lead



Build and Own Our Digital Revenue Engine



About Us



We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility or design patents. We manufacture in Canada where possible and source electronics overseas when required, then protect and position products properly.



We have dominated brick and mortar retail for decades. Our online channels are underdeveloped relative to product strength. We want fast, measurable improvement without the owner operating day to day.



The Role



This is a full-time ownership role, not support.



You will treat our ecommerce operation as if it were your own business. That means thinking in terms of revenue, margin, risk, prioritization, and long-term value, not tasks.



You will start by owning Amazon Seller Central execution and growth, then build and launch new channels from near zero, including Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



This role exists to remove work, decisions, and operational drag from ownership’s plate.



What You Will Own



Amazon Seller Central is live today and is your first priority. Other channels will be launched under your leadership once foundations are clean and reporting is in place.



You own outcomes across:



Amazon Seller growth, catalog health, pricing, promotions, inventory execution



Paid media performance, Amazon Ads first, then Meta when appropriate



Creative output quality and speed, images, A+ content, storefronts, video briefs



New channel builds and launches, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



You will manage an existing Amazon operations resource and rebuild creative production for speed, accuracy, and quality.



Ownership Expectations (Non-Negotiable)



You are expected to:



Think like an owner, not an employee



Make decisions without constant escalation



Prioritize work based on impact, not comfort



Take responsibility for mistakes and fix them quickly



Actively reduce the owner’s involvement over time



If you are waiting for instructions, this is not the role.



What Success Looks Like



Within 60 to 90 days:



Fewer day to day questions and approvals needed from ownership



Cleaner execution, fewer errors, faster turnaround



Simple, reliable weekly reporting



Clear 
ntum in Amazon performance and a concrete launch pipeline for new channels



If you do not materially reduce ownership’s workload, you are not succeeding.



Core Responsibilities



Build a 90-day plan and execute it with weekly cadence



Own Amazon Seller performance, SKUs, pricing, promotions, account health, inventory flow



Improve listing quality, conversion fundamentals, and creative consistency



Own Amazon Ads performance and testing discipline



Implement a simple KPI dashboard, revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, inventory health, next actions



Build and launch Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B channels once approved



Create SOPs so performance does not depend on one person



Hire and manage minimal support, typically 1 to 3 people over time



Required Profile



We are not looking for tool collectors or task executors.



You must have:



3+ years hands-on Amazon Seller Central experience



Proof you improved performance, not just maintained listings



Comfort with inventory, catalog, compliance, and operations



Ownership mindset and long-term thinking



Strong English and 2 to 3 hours daily overlap with Eastern Time



Preference for longer tenures over short contracts



Nice to have, not required:



Experience launching Shopify, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, or Grainger



Experience managing creatives or contractors



Compensation



Base: USD 1,200 to 1,500 per month



Performance upside tied to measurable revenue and margin improvement



Clear path to higher compensation as scope and ownership increase



How to Apply (Required)



Applications missing any item will be rejected.



Resume



A 200-word plan for your first 90 days, specific to our brands



Links to stores or brands you directly worked on, include outcomes where possible



Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video explaining one win and one mistake



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who act like owners, make decisions, and remove work from founders.

If you are looking for instructions, stability without accountability, or task-based work, do not apply.

title: Amazon Account Manager & PPC Specialist
description:
Job Title: Amazon Account Manager & PPC Specialist

Company: Woolbuddy

Work Setup: Remote (Work From Home)

title: Local SEO / GEO Growth Specialist - Australia Cosmetic Surgery Platform
description:

We're one of the largest cosmetic surgery platforms in Australia, operating across multiple locations. As we continue to scale, we're creating a new dedicated Local SEO / GEO Growth Specialist role to accelerate our organic presence.



What You'll Do:

- Execute comprehensive local SEO / GEO strategy for competitive cosmetic surgery keywords and queries across Australian cities we operate in

- Build and maintain local citations across Australian medical directories, forums, reddit, etc.

- Create and optimize content for procedure pages, location pages, and blog content

- Conduct keyword research specific to business

- Technical SEO audits and fixes (working with our team)

- Build high-quality backlinks from relevant Australian health and medical sources

- Monitor and report on rankings, traffic, and conversion metrics

- Stay current on Google algorithm updates and AI/LLM search trends



Requirements:

- 3+ years proven SEO experience with local SEO focus and GEO understanding

- Experience in healthcare/medical SEO highly preferred (understanding of medical advertising regulations/AHPRA guidelines a plus)

- Strong understanding of Australian search market and geography

- Must have experience working with LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)

- Knowledge of how AI/LLM systems are changing search and discovery

- Demonstrated results improving local rankings and organic traffic

- Experience with Google Business Profile optimization and local citation building

- Technical SEO knowledge (site speed, mobile optimization, schema markup)

- Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal)

- Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEO tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, or similar)



Big Plus If You Have:

- Understanding of medical practice marketing and patient journey

- Content creation skills for medical/educational content



What We Offer:

- Competitive compensation with incentive structure

- Flexible work hours

- Potential for long-term position with growth opportunity to support entire team

- Support from external SEO / GEO strategist for complex challenges

- Tech focused company

- Exciting industry and remote first team



To Apply:

You must reply with:

1. Salary expectations

2. Link to your portfolio or specific examples of local SEO / GEO results you've achieved

3. Explanation of how you would approach ranking for local search term "breast augmentation Melbourne" (<400 words)

4. Experience with LLMs and how you've applied them to SEO



Start Date: Immediate

title: Executive Operations Assistant (Part-Time to Full-Time)
description:
I run a digital marketing agency with active client work and a growing internal system (Vet Digital Growth). I’m hiring an Executive Operations Assistant to support daily operations, keep projects moving, and protect deadlines.



This is a hands-on role. You’ll work directly with me. Reliability, follow-through, and execution matter more than creativity.



Important – Read Carefully

This role is deadline-driven and operations-focused.



• Daily check-ins are required

• Tasks have clear due times

• Missed deadlines, late follow-ups, or inconsistent availability are not acceptable during probation

• Flexibility is earned after reliability is proven



If you struggle with punctuality, deadlines, or follow-through, this role is not a fit.





Responsibilities



• Manage inbox, scheduling, and follow-up communication

• Prepare summaries, meeting notes, SOPs, and documentation

• Track tasks and deadlines in Asana

• Organize client files, internal documents, and shared assets

• Perform research and deliver clear, concise summaries

• Assist with light tech and admin tasks (GHL, WordPress, Shopify, Google Workspace)

• Upload content, documents, and assets accurately and on time

• Handle basic admin tasks such as logs, receipts, and spreadsheets

• Send daily progress updates and flag blockers early

• Support ongoing operational workflows and internal systems





Non-Negotiables (Read This Twice)



• You show up on time, every day

• You meet deadlines without reminders

• You communicate early if something might slip

• You invoice on time, every time

• You do not disappear, sleep in, or go quiet without notice

• You take ownership of mistakes and fix them quickly





Requirements



• Excellent written and spoken English

• Strong organization and attention to detail

• Proven reliability in past roles

• Comfortable working inside structured workflows

• Comfortable learning multiple tools quickly

• Google Workspace experience required

• WordPress, Shopify, or GHL experience is a bonus

• Stable internet and a quiet work environment

• Willing to follow a clear system and reporting rhythm





Work Style (This Matters)



• You value structure over flexibility

• You prefer clarity over guessing

• You close loops

• You ask questions early, not after deadlines

• You understand that operations work requires consistency

• You are comfortable with more check-ins during the first 30 days





Schedule



• Part-time for the first 3 months (probation)

• Transition to full-time only after reliability is proven

• Required overlap: 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM Edmonton, Alberta (MST)

• You must adjust your start time during Daylight Savings

• Monday to Friday





Compensation



• Starting at $5.50 USD per hour (part-time)

• Paid bi-weekly

• Independent contractor role

• No 13th-month pay

• No employee benefits





To Apply (Incomplete applications are ignored)



Send all of the following:

 1. Resume / CV

 2. A 1–2 minute video introducing yourself

 3. A short explanation of your experience with admin or operations work

 4. A link to your internet speed test

 5. A link to a recent portfolio or work samples (if applicable)

 6. Confirmation that you can reliably work 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM MST



Only applicants who fully meet the requirements will be considered.

title: Chatbot & Automation Assistant
description:
The Chatbot & Automation Assistant will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and continuously improving our AI-powered chatbot. This role sits at the intersection of data, automation, operations, and customer experience.



You will help ensure that the chatbot delivers accurate, helpful, and reliable responses by assisting in maintaining its knowledge base, monitoring performance, improving workflows, and implementing automation strategies. This role requires strong analytical thinking, technical skills, and a passion for AI-driven solutions.



Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

-Chatbot Management: Maintain and update the chatbot’s knowledge base, prompts, workflows, and response logic.



-Content & Knowledge Operations: Curate, organize, and validate chatbot training data, FAQs, documentation, and internal resources.



-Quality Assurance: Monitor chatbot conversations to identify errors, gaps, and improvement opportunities.



-Performance Monitoring: Track chatbot usage, accuracy, resolution rate, and user satisfaction.



-Automation & Optimization: Build formulas, scripts, and automations to improve chatbot workflows and reporting.



-Data Analysis & Reporting: Create dashboards and reports on chatbot performance and adoption.



-Documentation: Maintain clear documentation of chatbot processes, logic, and improvement roadmap.



-Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with Data, Operations, HR, and leadership teams to align chatbot capabilities with business needs.





-Continuous Improvement: Proactively propose enhancements to chatbot accuracy, intelligence, and efficiency.



QUALIFICATIONS:

-AI & Chatbot Platforms: Familiarity with chatbot platforms, AI tools, or conversational AI systems (at least 1 year of experience in the same field).



-Google Sheets & Data Tools: Strong proficiency in Google Sheets for tracking, reporting, and automation.



-Automation & Scripting: 1 year of experience with formulas and Google Apps Script for workflow automation.



-Data Analysis: Ability to analyze chatbot conversations, performance metrics, and usage trends.



-Prompt Engineering: Ability to design, test, and refine prompts to improve chatbot accuracy and behavior.



-Knowledge Management: Experience organizing structured knowledge bases, FAQs, and documentation.



-Quality Assurance: Strong attention to detail for validating chatbot responses and logic.



-Security & Access Control: Understanding of data privacy, access control, and responsible AI practices.



-Collaboration Skills: Strong communication skills and experience working cross-functionally.



-Continuous Learning: Strong interest in AI, automation, and emerging technologies.



-Programming Languages & Technical Stack.



Candidates are expected to either already have or be willing to learn the following technologies:

-Core Languages



-JavaScript – for Google Apps Script, automation, and integrations



-Python (optional but highly valuable) – for data analysis, AI tooling, and backend automation



-SQL (basic) – for querying chatbot logs and analytics databases



-Automation & AI Tools



-Google Apps Script



-Google Sheets Automation



-Chatbot / AI platforms (internal or third-party)



-API integrations (REST, JSON)



-BigQuery (optional, for analytics scaling)



-Dashboarding tools (internal or BI platforms)



PERK & BENEFITS:

-Strong focus on work-life balance

title: Full-Time SEO, Website, Marketing, Video, & Graphic Design in California
description:
$600 per month plus $100 raises every 6 months



This is a long-term, full-time position for the right candidate. It is a graveyard shift role working Monday through Friday from 8:30am to 5:00pm California-time.



We are a small kitchen showroom and interior design business in San Francisco, California, looking for an administrator/marketer/SEO manager to join our growing team.



This role includes excellent pay, benefits, and opportunities for growth and advancement.



What We Offer

- The starting salary is $600 USD per month.

- A $100 raise every six months for the first two years up to $1000 monthly.

- Annual performance-based salary increases after that.

- 13th month pay annually.

- 20 days of paid vacation, public holidays, and sick leave.

- A long-term position and a full member of our friendly, growing team.

- Opportunities for career development and advancement.



Who We Are

ARTEZIA European Cabinetry | Design Studio is a San Francisco Bay Area-based interior design and custom cabinetry firm specializing in high-end kitchen design and builds.

Read more about us here: 
/our-story



Must-Haves

- Ability to work full time 40 hours per week Monday through Friday 8:30am to 5pm California time.

- Trustworthy, loyal, innovative, highly detail-oriented, excellent listening skills, and a great attitude.

- Canva, WordPress, Wix, and a working knowledge of SEO. Good design aesthetic and graphic design skills are required. Any certifications are a plus.

- Good laptop with a camera and fast internet connection in a quiet location.

- 2+ years of Excel experience, working knowledge of MS Office, Dropbox, and Google Apps, and the ability to learn new applications.

- Strong understanding of marketing principles, including
 marketing, social media management, website building, and SEO principles.

- Excellent communication skills by
, phone, and Zoom calls.

- Bonus: Prior experience with US business and working remotely for US-based companies.



Responsibilities

- Maintaining the company website on Wix, making adjustments to pages as needed, and working with our remote SEO team to best guide traffic to our website

- Creating graphic design presentations, estimates, proposals, and mood boards for our kitchen design and cabinetry clients to help sell projects.

- Assisting all tea
mbers with administration tasks.

- Managing social media presence on Instagram,
, Google, Yelp, Houzz, Youtube, and Pinterest.

- Help create and implement
 marketing campaigns

- Write and post blog articles on the website with a compelling narrative about kitchen design and European cabinetry to help drive traffic to our website.

- Work successfully with numerous clients, vendors, and tea
mbers.



To Apply:

- Send a copy of your resume and link to your onlinejobs.ph profile.

- Please send at least three professional references that we can call or
.

- Write us a short note about what attracted you to this position, why we should hire you, and when you will be available to start. Include the term “San Francisco SEO Specialist” in the subject line.

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: TikTok Account Specialist (TikTok Shop experience is a big plus!) )
description:
TikTok Account Specialist 

Remote | Full-Time 



We’re looking for a TikTok-native Account Specialist to own and grow our TikTok presence and TikTok Shop in the health supplement space. This role goes beyond posting videos — you’ll be responsible for content performance, creator partnerships, and TikTok Shop revenue growth. 



If you love TikTok, understand what makes content sell (not just go viral), have a personal interest in health & wellbeing and want a role where your work directly impacts results — this is for you.  



Who are we? 

Founded by two women and driven by a genuine passion for improving people’s health, this science-based supplement brand creates products using high-quality ingredients at therapeutic doses designed to deliver real impact.  



You’ll be joining a small, dynamic, international team working across multiple time zones. This role suits someone who is self-driven, confident in taking initiative, enjoys diving into the details, and thrives on learning and continuous growth.  

 



What You’ll Be Responsible For 



1. TikTok & TikTok Shop Management 

 - Manage and grow the brand TikTok account 

 - Upload, optimise, and manage TikTok Shop product listings 

 - Optimise product titles, descriptions, videos, and offers for conversion 

 - Monitor TikTok Shop analytics and sales performance 



2. Content Strategy & Execution 

 - Build and manage a TikTok content calendar 

 - Repurpose existing brand content into TikTok-native formats 

- Identify trends, hooks, and formats that drive engagement and sales 

- Test, analyse, and optimise content performance 



3. Creator & Affiliate Management 

 - Create clear briefs for UGC and TikTok creators 

 - Source, onboard, and manage creators and affiliates 

 - Conduct creator outreach and relationship management 

 - Track creator performance and scale high-ROI partnerships 



4. Reporting & Optimisation 

 - Track key KPIs (views, engagement, conversion, sales) 

 - Share insights and recommendations with the team 

 - Continuously improve performance based on data 



 What We’re Looking For 

 - Strong understanding of TikTok trends, culture, and content styles 

 - Experience managing TikTok accounts or TikTok Shop (brand, agency, or creator side) 

 - Comfortable working with creators and UGC 

 - Data-driven mindset — you look at numbers, not just likes 

 - Excellent written English for briefs and communication 

 - Proactive, organised, and able to work independently 

 - A passion for the health and wellbeing space 



 TikTok Shop experience is a big plus! 



 

Compensation & Benefits 



Salary:  Competitive based on experience

title: Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)
description:
Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)



Remote — Philippines | Full-Time



About SocialScience



SocialScience is a growth marketing agency that manages paid search and paid social campaigns for high-growth brands across B2B and DTC. We specialize in performance-driven creative testing and media strategy designed to reduce customer acquisition costs and scale revenue.



We are hiring a Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist to become the central data engine behind all client performance reporting across platforms.



This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a performance marketing analytics role for someone who understands how ad platforms work and how to read, organize, and interpret paid media data.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for pulling, organizing, and analyzing performance data across multiple advertising platforms three times per week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday). You will maintain standardized reporting across clients, identify performance trends, and support our media buying team with clean, reliable data that helps drive decisions.

Over time, you will also help build cross-client insights, creative performance tracking, audit preparation, and budget pacing systems.



You will become the data nerve center for all SocialScience clients.



Key Responsibilities

Core Reporting (Primary Responsibility)

Pull performance reports from:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

TikTok Ads Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Update master reporting sheets for all clients (3x per week)

Maintain consistent, accurate data across all client reporting templates

Build and maintain pivot tables to analyze:

CPA trends

CTR, CPC, CVR performance

Creative performance

Audience performance

Budget pacing by platform

Identify unusual performance changes and flag them to media buyers

Media Buyer Support

Prepare data sheets before optimization sessions

Maintain historical data for trend analysis

Support quarterly planning with performance summaries

Assist in forecasting and budget pacing sheets

Audit & Case Study Preparation

Pull last 60–90 days of structured data for new client audits

Maintain “before and after” performance data for case studies

Organize campaign structure and performance summaries for strategy reviews

Creative & Audience Insights (Advanced Responsibility)

Track which creatives and audiences perform best across clients

Maintain a creative performance library

Identify patterns across accounts that inform strategy



Required Experience & Skills

3+ years experience working with paid media platforms in an agency or in-house role

Strong working knowledge of:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Advanced proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets

Pivot tables (required)

Excel Formulas and data organization

Deep understanding of:

CPA, CPC, CTR, CVR, ROAS

Campaign ? Ad Set ? Ad structure

How performance data should be interpreted

Experience pulling reports directly from ad platforms

Extremely detail-oriented and process-driven



Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

Looker Studio / Google Data Studio

Supermetrics or other data connectors

Understanding of UTMs and tracking structure

Experience creating standardized reporting templates



What Success Looks Like in This Role

Within 60 days, you will:

Own reporting for all SocialScience clients

Have standardized reporting templates across accounts

Provide media buyers with clean data before they begin optimizations

Identify performance issues before the team does

Maintain historical data that makes audits and case studies easy



You Are a Great Fit If You

Love working with data and spreadsheets

Notice patterns in numbers quickly

Prefer organized systems over messy information

Can follow processes exactly and consistently

Have worked inside ad platforms and understand how campaigns function

Take pride in accuracy and reliability



Working Schedule

Must be available during overlapping hours with U.S. Eastern Time

Reporting cadence: Monday, Wednesday, Friday



How to apply:

1. Send your Portfolio and Resume to: 

2. Tell us a story of a significant event in your life that has shaped you

3. Send a quick 1 minute voice/video note introducing yourself



See you!

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Senior Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
Growfactor (
) is a UK-based specialist accounting firm helping entrepreneurs achieve clarity, confidence, and growth through smart tax optimisation, strategic planning, and modern financial systems. We support a wide range of businesses — from creative agencies to e-commerce — with expert guidance designed to turn financial complexity into lasting success.



NOTE: Please apply only if you have prior experience supporting a CEO/founder (or senior executive) in an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff, or Executive Partner capacity. 



This is a high-trust, high-responsibility role designed to remove the Founder from day-to-day decisions and manual work. The Executive Partner acts as an executive partner—owning time protection, system building, and execution across business and personal operations. The goal is to create leverage through systems, automation, and independent problem-solving.



Mission: 



Free up 30–40 hours per week of the executives time by:

 - Eliminating manual work

- Building systems that prevent repeat problems

- Owning execution across business and personal admin

- Acting as a thinking partner (not a task taker)



Responsibilities: 



Design and manage calendar architecture (priorities, buffers, meeting rules)

Gatekeep requests and protect focus time

Prepare pre-call briefs and ensure clear agendas

Own post-call actions: notes, tasks, follow-ups—without needing reminders

Build “inbox zero” and smart notification systems (no constant manual checking)

Turn voice notes and loose direction into clear tasks and execution

Use AI tools to draft, summarise, and systemise work (not just “assist”)

Build SOPs as work is done (documentation is part of execution)

Automate wherever possible using tools like Zapier / Make / GoHighLevel

Handle initial lead conversations, qualification, and correct call booking

Draft first-pass sales scripts and follow-ups (AI supported)

Create simple Canva visuals and quick LinkedIn content from Founder ideas

Coordinate partnerships, launches, tools, follow-ups, and payment/logistics

Travel planning with preferences saved (flights, bookings, itineraries)

Handle personal admin backlog and recurring life logistics

Manage “annoying but important” tasks quietly and consistently (insurance chasing, household logistics, etc.)



Skills & Qualifications



Works from voice notes + loose direction; clarifies once then runs

Uses AI to reduce workload, not increase it

Google Sheets/Excel (filters, formulas, simple dashboards)

Calendar/inbox systems

title: Amazon Online Arbitrage Product Researcher (Performance-Based)
description:
We are a U.S.-based Amazon FBA business looking for an experienced Online Arbitrage product researcher who can deliver results immediately. This role is not training-based and has no ramp period. We are looking for someone confident in their ability to produce strong sourcing results from Day 1.



This position is best suited for researchers who are comfortable being measured on output and who have worked in fast-paced, numbers-driven sourcing roles before.



Performance Metric (DPP):

Performance in this role is measured using DPP (Daily Profit Potential).

DPP means the total estimated profit from approved ASINs purchased in one day.



Example:

If in one day the following ASINs are purchased:

• $20 profit × 3 units

• $15 profit × 3 units

• $10 profit × 4 units

• $8 profit × 5 units

• Several other ASINs at $5–$7 profit with 2–3 units each



And the combined profit adds up to $300, then your DPP for that day is $300. DPP is tracked daily and averaged over time to evaluate performance.



Trial Period:

All candidates who pass the written screening will complete a brief interview with our Operations Manager.

Candidates who pass the interview will then proceed to a paid one-week trial.

• Trial length: up to 5 working days (maximum 40 hours)

• Performance is evaluated from Day 1

• There is no training or ramp period



During the trial:

• Results are expected immediately and must be consistent through the week

• $200 average daily DPP is the minimum performance baseline

We reserve the right to end the trial early if performance is clearly below expectations.



Pay & Performance Upside:

This role is designed for researchers who want to be paid for results, not just hours.



Researchers who perform well earn monthly performance incentives based on DPP. Strong researchers in our business are able to reach $300+ average daily DPP, which results in meaningful monthly incentive pay.

$200 average daily DPP is the baseline. Any performance above $200 earns a monthly incentive.



Incentive formula:

(Average daily DPP ? 200) × 20 working days × 15%

Example:

Average daily DPP = $300

That is $100 above baseline

$100 × 20 = $2,000

15% = $300 incentive for the month



The hourly base rate is set at a standard VA level, with higher earnings coming from performance-based incentives.

Monthly examples are for illustration only. Actual earnings depend on hours worked and DPP performance.

Sustained performance below expectations is subject to a performance improvement plan.



How to Apply (Required):

We use a written screening questionnaire as the first step. This is required.

Please complete the questionnaire at the link below:





Do not send messages through OnlineJobs.ph.

Only completed questionnaires will be reviewed.

Candidates who pass the questionnaire will be contacted by
 for the next step.

s and payment gateway disputes?

 or similar platforms?

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Hiring: Hand-Drawn Thumbnail Designer
description:
We’re looking for a hand-drawn thumbnail designer to create explainer-style YouTube thumbnails for multiple channels.



What you’ll do:

Create explainer video thumbnails in specific styles

Draw 8–15 hand-drawn circles per thumbnail

Adapt designs for different channels





Job type: Part-time

Pay: $5 per thumbnail



Ongoing work — 50+ thumbnails per month



Test requirement (MANDATORY)



To apply, share a short video showing how you draw a hand-drawn circle. No full thumbnail is needed, we want to see your process. Submitting only a static image or thumbnail is NOT sufficient.



Try to replicate this style as closely as possible: 









Choose one topic for your demo circle:



Religion

Nations

Laws

Human Rights

Corporations



Applications without a demo will not be considered.
